relating: the Collection_definition that collects the Part_instance objects

4.2.48 Collection_definition   

A Collection_definition is a type of Part_version_view that is a is the definition of a Part_version that serves as a collector for Part_instance objects that are mounted in the same vehicle but may not be assembled together.

EXAMPLE    Brake pads on the left and right front brake from same supplier, locks and keys of the car all from one supplier, wooden panels in the interior from the same supplier (to ensure common structure of the wood) are examples for collections.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Collection_definition
  SUBTYPE OF (Part_version_view);
  purpose : OPTIONAL STRING;
INVERSE
  collected_parts : SET[2:?] OF Collected_part_relationship FOR relating;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

purpose: the rationale behind the Collection_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

collected_parts: the Part_instance objects which are collected by a Collection_definition.

4.2.49 Component_placement   

A Component_placement is an information object pertaining to the placement of a Physical_breakdown_element, which has its own Cartesian_coordinate_space, in the coordinate space of a second and reference Physical_breakdown_element.

EXAMPLE 1   An example for the use of a Component_placement is the placement of the Physical_breakdown_element 'steering wheel' dependent on left hand versus right hand car steering in different countries.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Component_placement;
  placed_component : Physical_breakdown_element;
  placement : transformation_select;
  reference_component : Physical_breakdown_element;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

placed_component: the Physical_breakdown_element that is positioned relative to the reference_component.

NOTE 1   The Component_placement does not define the placement for all variants of the placed_component in the context of a reference_component.

The coordinate system of the placed_component is defined by the Geometric_model or External_geometric_model that represents the shape of the placed_component.

NOTE 2   If the shape of the Part_instance is not different from the shape of the Part_version_view referred to by the instance of Part_shape, the Geometric_model representing this shape is shared.

placement: the Geometric_model or External_model_relationship or the Geometric_model or Template_instance that defines the position of the placed_component relatively to the reference_component. In the case of Geometric_model or Template_instance, the scale shall be omitted or set to 1.0 .

The Geometric_model or Geometric_model associated with the reference_component shall contain Geometric_model or Axis_placement objects to locate all related placed components and may contain additional instances of geometric entities to describe shape aspects that are relevant in the context of the reference_component.

EXAMPLE 2   The Geometric_model or Geometric_model associated with the reference_component 'car engine' may contain Geometric_model or Axis_placement objects that locate the gear box and the crankshaft and additional geometric information that represent the envelope box that is allowed for the car engine.

reference_component: the high level Physical_breakdown_element that is defined in the reference coordinate space. A Model_property_assignment shall be assigned to the Physical_breakdown_element to define this reference coordinate space.

Informal propositions:

IP1: The Geometric_model or External_geometric_model that is referred to indirectly by the placement attribute shall be associated with the placed_component Physical_breakdown_element through an object of Shape_description_association and an object of Part_shape that is referenced through is_defining_shape_for.

4.2.50 Configuration   

A Configuration is a the association of a Class_condition_association or a Class_specification_association object with a design or with a process in order to define a valid usage of it in the context of a certain Product_class.

NOTE 1   The validity of the association may be limited by a time period through assigning an Effectivity object to it.

NOTE 2   The semantics of the kind of association is defined by the attributes configuration_type and inheritance_type.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Configuration;
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  configuration_type : STRING;
  configured_element : configured_item_select;
  id : OPTIONAL Id_with_context;
  inheritance_type : STRING;
  is_solution_for : configured_specification_select;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: other identifiers that may be used to distinguish the Configuration. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

configuration_type: the valid usage of a Configuration object that is applied to the application object as configured_element. The following values shall be used:

  • 'design': The object referenced as configured_elementhas to be designed and verified before it can actually be used in a given context. This context is specified by the Class_condition_association and Class_specification_association objects referenced as the is_solution_for. This type of Configuration is applicable for Alternative_solution, Breakdown_element, Process_plan, or Process_operation_occurrence objects;
  • 'usage': The object referenced as the configured_element is controlled by a Configuration. The Class_condition_association and Class_specification_association objects specify the usage cases and are referenced as the is_solution_for.

This type of Configuration is applicable for Alternative_solution, Part_instance, Process_plan, Process_operation_occurrence, or Physical_breakdown_element objects.

EXAMPLE 1   The presence of an optional third rear axle of a truck is controlled by specifications on the level of Physical_breakdown_element.

EXAMPLE 2   A 'sunroof' has to be provided, i.e., designed for a class of vehicles that has an optional 'sunroof' as part of its specification.

configured_element: the element that is controlled for its valid usage by the Configuration.

id: the identifier for the Configuration. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

inheritance_type: specifies whether or not an inheritance scheme for the configuration information in a hierarchical structure is applied to the application object referenced as the configured_element. The levels within such a hierarchy are defined through Realization_or_occurrence_relationship objects or the attribute base_element of Alternative_solution. The following values shall be used:

  • 'exception': No inheritance scheme is applicable and all required configuration information must be attached locally at the application object. The value indicates that the configuration information may be inconsistent to the structural levels above it or that it is, on purpose, contradictory to it. Such a condition implies that an inheritance scheme shall not continue beyond this point in the product structure tree

EXAMPLE 3   A situation where the inheritance_type 'exception' is applicable is a technical solution released for one particular customer without support in higher structure levels.

  • 'inherited': A scheme for inheritance of configuration information applies. The complete configuration information shall be collected from the different levels in the structure by evaluation of results. The results shall be evaluated using the logical AND to combine configuration information starting at the referenced configured_element and using the logical OR to combine alternatives. In addition, this evaluation shall consider related effectivity information. 'inherited' only applies for objects for which the same value of configuration_type is defined;

EXAMPLE 4   The following figure shows how inheritance is applied along the tree of a product structure.




Figure 1 —  Inheritance along product structure tree

The complete configuration information of a Part_instance can be obtained by adding any such information to Alternative_solution objects which are linked through Realization_or_occurrence_relationship objects and base_element attributes respectively. Whenever more than one higher level instance is present, the current information available is branched in as many branches as instances are present. For example, the total configuration information for the Part_instance given in the figure above could be expressed as follows: (C0.0 AND C1.0 AND C2.0) OR (C0.0 AND C1.1 AND C2.1) OR (C0.0 AND C1.1 AND C2.2).

  • 'local': No inheritance scheme is applicable and all required configuration information must be attached locally at the application object. Nevertheless, any potentially inherited configuration information of a higher level shall be consistent, i.e., it shall be a subset of the locally defined configuration information.

is_solution_for: the characteristic or combination of characteristics for which the object referenced as the configured_element provides a solution or which is needed to control a process operation. These characteristics are defined by a Class_specification_association and combinations of characteristics are defined by a Class_condition_association where the attribute condition_type is 'part usage'.

4.2.51 Contract   

A Contract is a binding agreement.

EXAMPLE 1   Contracts may concern the design of part version objects, the delivery of drawing objects, or the execution of activity objects.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Contract;

INVERSE
  releases : SET[0:?] OF Organization_in_contract FOR signed_contracts;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: other identifiers that may be used to distinguish the Contract. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

contract_type: the text that identifies the type of the Contract.

description: the text that provides further information about the Contract. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

EXAMPLE 2   The description of the Contract may be the ordered price.

id: the identifier for the Contract.

releases: the Organization_in_contract objects that are involved in the Contract.

Informal propositions:

IP1: A Contract id shall be unique within the scope of an organization.

(*

4.2.57 Date_and_person_assignment   

A Date_and_person_assignment is a an object that associates a Date_and_person_organization with product data. This assignment provides additional information for the associated object. The provision of such data through this assignment has an organizational character whereas some objects require the same kind of data in order to be semantically complete. This assignment shall not be used to associate the corresponding organizational data with an object whose attributes are referencing the organizational data directly.

EXAMPLE 1   An example for the requirement stated is that there shall not exist a Date_and_person_assignment with a role of 'requestor' that refers to a Work_request, since this object refers directly to Date_and_person_organization in that role.

NOTE    In the context of the object Date_and_person_assignment, the expression 'referenced object' means 'a concept that is conveyed within one of the instances referred to by the attribute is_assigned_to and not one of the instances referred to by this attribute.

EXAMPLE 2   If applied to an instance of Item with role 'creation', the Date_and_person_assignment specifies the creation date of the part, tool, or raw material as a new object in the activity domain of the organization, and not the creation date of the instance of Part in the product management system of the organization.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Date_and_person_assignment;
  assigned_date_and_person : Date_and_person_organization;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  is_assigned_to : SET[1:?] OF date_time_person_organization_element_select;
  role : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

assigned_date_and_person: specifies the Date_and_person_organization.

description: the text that provides further information about the Date_and_person_assignment. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

is_assigned_to: specifies the set of objects with which the Date_and_person_assignment is associated.

role: specifies the relationship between the date or time and the person or organization in the Date_and_person_assignment. Where applicable the following values shall be use:

  • 'creation': The assignment specifies that the referenced object has been created by the given person or organization at the given date and time;
  • 'update': The assignment specifies that the referenced object has been altered by the given person or organization at the given date and time.

4.2.58 Date_and_person_organization   

A Date_and_person_organization is a Person_in_organization or an Organization associated with a Date_time.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Date_and_person_organization;
  date : Date_time;
  person_or_organization : person_organization_select;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

date: specifies the date and an optional time of day component of a Date_and_person_organization.

person_or_organization: specifies the Organizationor the Person_in_organization that is part of the Date_and_person_organization.

4.2.59 Date_or_date_time_assignment   

A Date_or_date_time_assignment is an association of point in time specified as a Date_time with product data. This assignment provides additional information for the associated object. The provision of such data through this assignment has an organizational character whereas some objects require the same kind of data mandatorily in order to be semantically complete. This assignment shall not be used to associate the corresponding organizational data with an object whose attributes are referencing the organizational data directly.

EXAMPLE 1   An example for the requirement stated is that there shall not exist a Date_or_date_time_assignment with a role of 'actual start date' that refers to an Activity, since this object refers directly to Date_time in that role.

NOTE    In the context of the object Date_or_date_time_assignment, the expression 'referenced object' means a concept that is conveyed within one of the instances referred to by the attribute is_assigned_to and not one of the instances referred to by this attribute.

EXAMPLE 2   If applied to an instance of Part with role 'creation', the Date_or_date_time_assignment specifies the creation date of the part, tool, or raw material as a new object in the activity domain, and not the creation date of the instance of Part in a product management system.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Date_or_date_time_assignment;
  assigned_date : Date_time;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  is_assigned_to : SET[1:?] OF date_time_person_organization_element_select;
  role : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

assigned_date: specifies the Date_time that is associated with the product data.

description: the text that provides further information about the Date_or_date_time_assignment. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

is_assigned_to: specifies the set of objects of product data with which the Date_or_date_time_assignment is associated.

role: specifies the action associated with the Date_or_date_time_assignment. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • 'classification date': The assignment specifies that the specified object is classified at the given date and time. This value shall only be used, if the Date_or_date_time_assignment refers to instances of Class_assignment as is_assigned_to;
  • 'creation': The assignment specifies that the referenced object was created at the given date and time;
  • 'installation': The assignment specifies that the referenced object was mounted in a product at the given date and time;

    EXAMPLE 3   This role is applicable, e.g., when referring to a Physical_instance.

  • 'production': The assignment specifies that the referenced object was produced at the given date and time;

    EXAMPLE 4   This role is applicable, e.g., when referring to a Physical_instance.

  • 'registration': The assignment specifies that the referenced object was determined at the given date and time;

    EXAMPLE 5   This role is applicable, e.g., when referring to a Property.

  • 'update': The assignment specifies that the referenced object was altered at the given date and time.

4.2.60 Date_time   

A Date_time is the specification of a date and an optional time of day. The representation of date and time shall be according to ISO 8601.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Date_time;
  date : STRING;
  time : OPTIONAL STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

date: the calendar time, defined according to the Gregorian calendar, conveying information about the year, the month, and the day in no specific order. The representation of a date shall be complete, i.e., millennium, century, and year-within-century data shall be included.

time: the moment of occurrence measured by hour, minute, and second. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.61 Dated_configuration   

A Dated_configuration is a type of Manufacturing_configuration that applies onwards from a given date, or between a start and an end date.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Dated_configuration
  SUBTYPE OF (Manufacturing_configuration);
  end_definition : OPTIONAL event_or_date_select;
  start_definition : event_or_date_select;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

end_definition: the date and time when the validity of the configured_element is not defined any longer. The value of this attribute need not be specified. If the end_definition is not specified, the Dated_configuration is considered as valid forever from the start_definition.

start_definition: the first date when the Dated_configuration is valid.

4.2.62 Dated_effectivity   

A Dated_effectivity is a type of Effectivity for which the domain of applicability is defined as an interval of time bounded by dates or events. The interval may be open-ended.

Depending on whether the end_definition attribute is specified, the actual domain of time defined by a Dated_effectivity is:

  • either, the time interval between the start and end date or event;
  • or, the open time interval that starts at the start date or event.

If the end_definition is an event that actually identifies a point in time that comes before the start_definition, then the actual domain of effectivity is empty.

EXAMPLE    The Event objects may be used to bound a Dated_effectivity period, which may be especially useful at a planning stage.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Dated_effectivity
  SUPERTYPE OF (Data_validity_period)
  SUBTYPE OF (Effectivity);
  end_definition : OPTIONAL event_or_date_select;
  start_definition : OPTIONAL event_or_date_select;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

end_definition: the date or event that defines the upper bound of the interval of applicability. The value of this attribute need not be specified. If the value for this attribute is not specified, the interval of applicability has no upper limit.

start_definition: the Date_time or Event that defines the lower bound of the interval of applicability. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.63 Design_constraint   

A Design_constraint is a definition of a version of requirement that impacts the design of some physical or functional elements.

NOTE    In the present context, design of a functional or physical element means design of parts that realize or fulfils the functional or organic requirement.

EXAMPLE 1   Ergonomic information like 'hip point' or 'forward driver vision' as well as 'door opening control lines', 'shipping critical dimensions', or 'stone throw zone' are examples of design constraint.

EXAMPLE 2   The standard diameter of soft drink cans is a constraint for designing the hole of a cup holder in a car.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Design_constraint;
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  defined_for : OPTIONAL Requirement_version;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  id : Id_with_context;
  is_valid_for : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Product_class;
  name : OPTIONAL STRING;
  version_id : OPTIONAL STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: the other identifiers that distinguish the Design_constraint. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

defined_for: a definition of a Requirement_version. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

description: the text that provides further information about the Design_constraint. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

id: the identifier for the Design_constraint.

is_valid_for: the physical or functional element defined through the Product_class. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

name: the words by which the Design_constraint is known. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

version_id: the identification of a particular version of a Design_constraint. The version_id shall be unique within the scope of a Design_constraint. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.64 Design_constraint_association   

A Design_constraint_association is an association between a Design_constraint and a Breakdown_element whose design is impacted by the design constraint.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Design_constraint_association;
  associated_breakdown_element : Breakdown_element;
  association_design_constraint : Design_constraint;
  name : OPTIONAL STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

associated_breakdown_element: the Breakdown_element whose design is constrained by the associated design constraint.

association_design_constraint: the Design_constraint that is associated.

name: the words by which the Design_constraint_association is known. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.65 Design_constraint_relationship   

A Design_constraint_relationship is a relationship between two design constraints. Where applicable, the relation_typeattribute shall take the following values:

  • 'decomposition': the related Design_constraint is a component of the relating "Design constraint definition";
  • 'precedence': the related Design_constraint has higher priority than the relating "Design constraint definition".

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Design_constraint_relationship;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  related : Design_constraint;
  relating : Design_constraint;
  relation_type : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

description: the text that provides further information about the Design_constraint_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

related: the meaning of the relationship.

relating: the first design constraint that is related.

relation_type: the meaning of the relationship.

4.2.66 Digital_document_definition   

A Digital_document_definition is a type of Document_definition that collects files that are archived on an optical computer disc, magnetic, electronic storage, or a combination thereof. A Digital_document_definition may consist of one or many component Digital_file.

4.2.68 Direction   

A Direction is an object that defines a general direction vector in two or three dimensional space. The actual magnitudes of the components have no effect upon the direction being defined, only the ratios x:y:z or x:y are significant.

NOTE    The components of this entity are not normalised. If a unit vector is required it should be normalised before use.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Direction;
  direction_ratios : LIST[2:3] OF REAL;
  name : OPTIONAL STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

direction_ratios: is a list, the individual elements of this list are defined below.

  • direction_ratios[1]: The component in the direction of the X axis.
  • direction_ratios[2]: The component in the direction of the Y axis.
  • direction_ratios[3]: The component in the direction of the Z axis; this value shall not be present in the case of a direction in two-dimensional coordinate space.

name: the words by which the Direction is known. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.69 Document

4.2.70 Document_assignment   

A Document_assignment is a mechanism to associate a document with the objects, where the assigned document provides information about the object it is associated to.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Document_assignment;
  assigned_document : assigned_document_select;
  is_assigned_to : SET[1:?] OF documented_element_select;
  portion : OPTIONAL STRING;
  role : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

assigned_document: the Document, a Document_version, a Document_definition, or a File that is used to provide information.

is_assigned_to: the objects that information is provided for.

EXAMPLE 1   A document assigned to Activity_assignment may provide further description of the input or output of that activity.

portion: the word or group of the words that convey the subject or sub contents of the Document. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

role: the meaning of the Document_assignment. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • 'additional information': The assigned document provides information that is relevant for the associated object, but is not a description of the associated object itself;
  • 'behaviour': The assigned document specifies information about the behaviour of the associated object;
  • 'description': The assigned document provides textual information for the associated object itself;
  • 'informative': The assigned document may or may not be considered;
  • 'mandatory': The associated object shall conform to the content of the assigned document;
  • 'mathematical description': The assigned document specifies the associated object by providing the algorithmic specification of its behaviour.
  • 'dimensioning standard': The assigned document specifies the dimensioning standard;

    NOTE    The document shall be assigned to a Part_version_view.

    EXAMPLE 2   For a Physical_breakdown_element there is a textual document assigned, explaining the functionality, size, and other characteristics by a Document_assignment with role 'description'. Another document, representing the specification of the Product_class, in which the Physical_breakdown_element is used, is also assigned to the same Physical_breakdown_element by a Document_assignment with role 'additional information'.

4.2.71 Document_category   

A Document_category is a classification of a Document with respect to specific criteria. The specific criteria are covered in the name attribute.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Document_category;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  name : STRING;
  scope : Organization;
INVERSE
  categorized_documents : SET[1:?] OF Document FOR categories;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

description: the text that provides further information about the Document_category. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

name: the words by which the Document_category is known. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • 'catalogue': The assigned document is the catalogue in which the associated object is listed;

    EXAMPLE    The document can be the catalogue of the manufacturer.

  • 'manual': The assigned document is the handbook that is supplied for the associated object;
  • 'specification': The assigned document specifies the considerations that lead to the design finally chosen for the associated object.

scope: the organization in which the classification is defined.

categorized_documents: specifies the Document objects with which a particular Document_category is associated.

4.2.72 Document_content_property   

A Document_content_property is the specification of characteristics precising the content of a File or of a Document_definition. At least one of the optional attributes shall be specified for each instance of this object. In the case where a Document_content_property is referred by a Document_definition, the characteristics apply to all individual File objects, whereas in the case where it is referred by a File, the characteristics apply on an individual basis.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Document_content_property;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  detail_level : OPTIONAL STRING;
  geometry_types : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF STRING;
  languages : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Language;
  real_world_scale : OPTIONAL Numerical_value;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

description: the text that provides further information about the Document_content_property. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

detail_level: the level of detail that the File or the Document_definition provides. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • 'rough 3d shape': three-dimensional shape model without edge rounds and fillets;
  • 'rounded edges': three-dimensional shape model with edge rounds and fillets.

The value of this attribute need not be specified.

geometry_types: the kind or kinds of geometry that an object contains. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • '3D wireframe model': The document contains a three-dimensional shape model in wireframe representation;
  • '2D shape': The document contains a two-dimensional shape model or contours only;
  • 'surface model': The document contains a three-dimensional shape model in surface representation;
  • 'closed volume': The document contains a three-dimensional shape model in closed body topological surface representation;
  • 'solid model': The document contains a three-dimensional shape model in advanced boundary representation;
  • 'solid and surface model': The document contains a three-dimensional shape model in surface and advanced boundary representation;
  • 'assembly': The document contains an assembly structure with reference to the assembled components and their transformation matrices;
  • 'assembly with mating elements': The document contains an assembly structure including the mating components only, such as screws or rivets, with exact positioning information. This assembly representation is intended to be overlayed with the assembly structure for the main components;
  • '2D drawing': The document contains a technical drawing without three-dimensional shape representation;
  • 'drawing derived from 3D data': The document contains a technical drawing that has been derived from a three-dimensional shape model;
  • 'drawing related to 3D data': The document contains a technical drawing that visualizes a three-dimensional shape model and possibly establishes associative left to the three-dimensional shape model.

The value of this attribute need not be specified.

languages: the language or languages which are used in the characterized objects.

EXAMPLE    'Japanese' and 'German' are examples for the fact that annotation on a drawing is provided in the language 'Japanese' or 'German' respectively.

The value of this attribute need not be specified.

real_world_scale: the scale that is used in the File or in the Document_definition the Document_content_property is referred by. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.73 Document_creation_property   

A Document_creation_property is a specification of characteristics of File or of Document_definition objects. It specifies the context of the creation of the object. At least one of the optional attributes shall be specified for each instance of this object. In the case where a Document_creation_property is referred by a Document_definition the characteristics apply to all individual File objects, whereas in the case it is referred by a File, the characteristics apply on an individual basis.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Document_creation_property;
  creating_interface : OPTIONAL STRING;
  creating_system : STRING;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  operating_system : OPTIONAL STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

creating_interface: the computer application used to create the File or Document_definition object.

EXAMPLE    'Postscript Printer Driver' is an example for a creating interface of a Physical_document_definition.

The value of this attribute need not be specified.

creating_system: the computer application or the machine which is used to create the object that is characterized.

description: the text that provides further information about the Document_creation_property. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

operating_system: the operating system that is used to execute the computer application that created the characterized object. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.74 Document_definition   

A Document_definition is one of potentially more alternative representations of a Document_version.

NOTE 1   A Document_version may have more than one representation.

EXAMPLE    A version of a logical document, which contains a shape model, may be represented in the different native formats of two three-dimensional CAD systems.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Document_definition
  ABSTRACT SUPERTYPE OF (ONEOF (Digital_document_definition,
                                Physical_document_definition));
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  associated_document_version : Document_version;
  common_locations : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Document_location_identification;
  content : OPTIONAL Document_content_property;
  creation : OPTIONAL Document_creation_property;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  id : Id_with_context;
  name : OPTIONAL STRING;
  representation_format : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Document_format_property;
  size : OPTIONAL Document_size_property;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: other identifiers that may be used to distinguish the Document_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

associated_document_version: the version of the logical document that is being represented.

common_locations: the location of a Document_definition, where all its constituents can be found.

NOTE 2   Different common locations represent alternative representations of the same physical location.

The value of this attribute need not be specified.

content: the characteristics of the content of the Document_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

creation: further details of the creation of the Document_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

description: the text that provides further information about the Document_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

id: the identifier for the Document_definition.

name: the words by which the Document_definition is known. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

representation_format: the format of the document represented by Document_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

size: the size of the represented document. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.75 Document_definition_relationship   

A Document_definition_relationship is a relationship between two Document_definition objects.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Document_definition_relationship;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  placement : OPTIONAL transformation_select;
  related : Document_definition;
  relating : Document_definition;
  relation_type : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

description: the text that provides further information about the Document_definition_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

placement: the geometric Transformation that places and orients the related Document_definition relative to the relating Document_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

related: the second of the two objects related by the Document_definition_relationship.

NOTE 1   The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

relating: the first of the two objects related by the Document_definition_relationship.

NOTE 3   The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

relation_type: the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • 'addition': The application object specifies that the related document provides supplementary or collateral information with regard to the information provided by the relating document;
  • 'copy': The application object defines a relationship where the related Document_definition is a copy of the relating Document_definition;
  • 'decomposition': The application object defines a relationship where the related Document_definition is one of potentially more sub documents of the relating Document_definition;

    EXAMPLE 1   The decomposition of a document into clauses is an example for the use of this value.

  • 'derivation': The application object defines a relationship where the related Document_definition is derived from the relating Document_definition;

    EXAMPLE 2   A raster image may be derived from a three-dimensional CAD model.

    EXAMPLE 3   A html version may be derived from a text document as an alternative.

  • 'peer': The application object specifies that the related document provides required information with regard to that provided by the relating document. The peer document is essential for a complete understanding;
  • 'reference': The application object defines a relationship where the related document is referenced from the relating;

    EXAMPLE 4   A hyperlink is an example for a 'reference'.

  • 'sequence': The application object defines a logical sequence where the related Document_definition comes after the relating Document_definition;

    EXAMPLE 5   A sequence of clauses.

  • 'substitution': The application object defines a relationship where the related Document_definition replaces the relating Document_definition;
  • 'translation': The Document_definition_relationship specifies that the related document is generated through a translation process from the relating document.

4.2.76 Document_format_property   

A Document_format_property is a specification of characteristics of a File or of a Document_definition that specify the format of the object. At least one of the optional attributes shall be specified for each instance of this object. In the case where a Document_format_property is referred by a Document_definition the characteristics apply to all individual File objects, whereas in the case it is referred by a File the characteristics apply on an individual basis.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Document_format_property;
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  character_code : OPTIONAL STRING;
  data_format : OPTIONAL STRING;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  id : OPTIONAL Id_with_context;
  size_format : OPTIONAL Rectangular_size;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: other identifiers that may be used to distinguish the Document_format_property. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

character_code: the character code that is used in the characterized object. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • 'binary': The document contains data in binary format;
  • 'IEC 61286': The coded character set used to encode the document data according to IEC 61286;
  • 'ISO 646': The coded character set used to encode the document data according to ISO 646;

    NOTE 1   The character set in ISO 646 is identical to the character set commonly known as ASCII

  • 'ISO 6937': The coded character set used to encode the document data is according to ISO/IEC 6937;
  • 'ISO 8859-1': The coded character set used to encode the document data according to ISO 8859-1;

    NOTE 2   The character set in ISO 8859-1 is identical to the character set commonly known as LATIN-1.

  • 'ISO 10646': The coded character set used to encode the document data according to ISO/IEC 10646.

The value of this attribute need not be specified.

data_format: the convention that was used to structure the information in the characterized object. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • 'DXF': The document contains data in Drawing Exchange File format;
  • 'IGES': The document contains data in Initial Graphics Exchange Specification format;
  • 'ISO 10303-203': The document contains data in ISO 10303-203 format;
  • 'ISO 10303-214': The document contains data in ISO 10303-214 format;
  • 'TIFF CCITT GR4': The document contains data in TIFF CCITT GR4 format;
  • 'VDAFS': The document contains data in VDAFS format;
  • 'VOXEL': The document contains data in VOXEL format.

The value of this attribute need not be specified.

description: the text that provides further information about the Document_format_property. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

id: the identifier for the Document_format_property. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

size_format: the dimensions of a physical presentation of the object the size_format is provided for.

EXAMPLE 1   'ISO A0' is an example for the size_format of a drawing that is stored digitally.

EXAMPLE 2   '0.2 x 0.4 x 0.4 meters' is an example for the size_format of a wooden model.

The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.77 Document_location_identification   

A Document_location_identification is a type of External_source_identification that specifies where a File or a Document_definition can be found in a digital or physical data storage system.

EXAMPLE 1   An HTML file that includes a picture may be represented as a Document_definition made of two components:

  • the HTML file;
  • the binary file that contains the picture.

If these files were located within the same directory or relatively to the same directory, the source_id attribute would convey the directory name.

EXAMPLE 2   Examples of source_type are:

  • 'URL' - for a web page;
  • 'FTP' - for an FTP address;
  • 'ISBN' - for physical documents.

In the case where a Document_location_identification is referred by a Document_definition, the characteristics apply to all individual objects, whereas in the case it is referred by a File, the characteristics apply on an individual basis.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Document_location_identification
  SUBTYPE OF (External_source_identification);
END_ENTITY;
(*

4.2.78 Document_size_property   

A Document_size_property is the specification of the size of a File or of a Document_definition object. At least one of the optional attributes shall be specified for each instance of this object. In the case where a Document_size_property is referred by a Document_definition, the size information is the sum of the sizes of all individual objects that are collected by this object, whereas in the case it is referred by a File, the size information is the one of the individual objects that is referenced.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Document_size_property;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  file_size : OPTIONAL Value_with_unit;
  page_count : OPTIONAL Value_with_unit;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

description: the text that provides further information about the Document_size_property. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

file_size: the Value_with_unit that represents the size of a digitally stored document. The value of this attribute need not be specified. The file_size shall only be applied in cases where the Document_size_property is referred by a Digital_document_definition or a File.

EXAMPLE 1   '15021 Bytes' and 'less than 500 Bytes' are examples for a file_size.

The value of this attribute need not be specified.

page_count: the number of pages of the application object the Document_size_property is referred by. The value of this attribute need not be specified. The page_count shall only be used in cases where the Document_size_property is referred by a Hardcopy or a Physical_document_definition.

EXAMPLE 2   '42 pages' and 'more than 1 page' are examples of a page_count.

The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.79 Document_type_property   

A Document_type_property is a specification of the kind of a File.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Document_type_property;
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  document_type_name : STRING;
  id : OPTIONAL Id_with_context;
  used_classification_system : OPTIONAL Class_system;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: other identifiers that may be used to distinguish the Document_type_property. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

description: the text that provides further information about the Document_type_property. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

document_type_name: the word or the group of words that describe the kind of data that are contained in a File that refers to the Document_type_property. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • 'geometry': The document represents a shape model;
  • 'NC data': The document represents numerical control data;
  • 'FE data': The document represents finite element data;
  • 'sample data': The document represents measured data;
  • 'process plan': The document represents process planning data;
  • 'check plan': The document represents quality control planning data;
  • 'drawing': The document represents a technical drawing.

id: the identifier for the Document_type_property. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

used_classification_system: the Class_system the document_type_name is defined in.

EXAMPLE    A Document_type_property may be used with 'specification type 1' and 'specification type 2' as values for the attribute document_type_name due to a company wide definition. By inclusion of these types in a Class with name 'specification' and description 'specification of company XY' these types of documents are better classified and the meaning of 'specification type 1' and 'specification type 2' can be further detailed in an attached document to the Class or by a reference to a Class_system for document types with that organization.

The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.80 Document_version   

A Document_version is a release of a Document.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Document_version;
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  id : Id_with_context;
INVERSE
  document : Document FOR versions;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: the textual definition of the attribute. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

description: the text that provides further information about the Document_version. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

id: the identifier for the Document_version.

document: the logical document the Document_version is a version of.

4.2.81 Document_version_relationship   

A Document_version_relationship is a relationship between two Document_version objects.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Document_version_relationship;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  related : Document_version;
  relating : Document_version;
  relation_type : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

description: the text that provides further information about the Document_version_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

related: the second of the two objects related by the Document_version_relationship.

NOTE 1   The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

relating: the first of the two objects related by the Document_version_relationship.

NOTE 2   The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

relation_type: the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • 'derivation': The business object defines a deriving relationship where the related Document_version is based on the relating Document_version which is an earlier version of the same or of a different Document;
  • 'hierarchy': The business object defines a hierarchical relationship where the related Document_version is a sub version of the relating Document_version;

    EXAMPLE    'Revision 1.1' and 'revision 1.2' are examples of sub-versions of 'version 1'.

  • 'sequence': The business object defines a version sequence where the relating Document_version is the preceding version and the related Document_version is the following version.
  • 'supplied document': The business object defines a relationship between two Document_version objects representing the same object in different organizational contexts.

    NOTE 3   The different organizational contexts can be represented by different general organizational data associations with the related Document_version objects.

4.2.82 Duration   

A Duration is the definition of a period of time.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Duration;
  time : STRING;
  unit : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

time: specifies the extent of the Duration.

unit: specifies the unit in which the time is specified.

4.2.83 Duration_property_definition   

A Duration_property_definition is a type of Property_definition that specifies a period of time during which a given object is used or will last.

EXAMPLE    A Duration_property_definition may be used to specify the duration of a Process_operation_definition.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Duration_property_definition
  SUBTYPE OF (Property_definition);
END_ENTITY;
(*

4.2.84 Effectivity   

An Effectivity is an identification of the valid use of an aspect of product data tracked by date, event, serial number or lot size.

NOTE 1   An instance of Effectivity may define a period or a part of ineffectivity, i.e., of invalid use, if it is referred to by an instance of Effectivity_assignment with effectivity_indication set to 'false'.

A 'start' value shall always be specified for a particular type of Effectivity, an 'end' value may be specified.

NOTE 2   This application protocol does not allow to specify effectivity or ineffectivity intervals without start values.

NOTE 3   If period or lot-size are not specified, the effectivity or ineffectivity is endless.

An Effectivity may 'inherit' its interval from another Effectivity through an Effectivity_relationship with relation_type 'inheritance'. If a 'start' and no 'end' is specified, the period or lot-size is then added to 'start' in order to get the actual 'end' of the effectivity or ineffectivity.

If both 'start' and 'end' are specified, the period should not be specified because of redundancy. If specified, it shall be equal to the measure between the 'start' and the 'end' of the effectivity or ineffectivity.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Effectivity
  SUPERTYPE OF (ONEOF (Time_interval_effectivity,
                       Dated_effectivity,
                       Serial_effectivity,
                       Lot_effectivity));
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  concerned_organizations : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Organization;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  effectivity_context : OPTIONAL STRING;
  id : OPTIONAL Id_with_context;
  version_id : OPTIONAL STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: other identifiers that may be used to distinguish the Effectivity. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

concerned_organizations: the set of Organization objects in that the Effectivity is valid. The value of this attribute need not be specified. If concerned_organizations is an empty set, the Effectivity is globally applicable.

EXAMPLE    The Effectivity of the same part may be different in the various production sites of a car manufacturer.

NOTE 4   As Effectivity is in most cases organization dependent, it is recommended always to populate the concerned_organizations attribute.

The value of this attribute need not be specified.

description: the text that provides further information about the Effectivity. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

effectivity_context: the life cycle stage for which the Effectivity is valid. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

id: the identifier for the Effectivity. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

version_id: the identification of a particular version of the Effectivity. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.85 Effectivity_assignment   

An Effectivity_assignment is an object that associates an Effectivity with the product or activity data whose effectivity is controlled by the associated Effectivity. The association of an Effectivity to product or activity data does not imply any statement concerning the effectivity outside of the specified interval. The same applies in the absence of any assigned effectivity, i.e. no statement concerning the effectivity is implied.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Effectivity_assignment;
  assigned_effectivity : Effectivity;
  effectivity_indication : BOOLEAN;
  is_assigned_to : SET[1:?] OF effective_element_select;
  role : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

assigned_effectivity: the instance of Effectivity that is assigned.

effectivity_indication: the specification of whether the assigned_effectivity defines a period of effectivity (value equal 'TRUE') or a period of ineffectivity (value equal 'FALSE') for the is_assigned_to. In the first case, use of is_assigned_to objects is or was valid during the considered period.

NOTE    This does not imply that use of the is_assigned_to objects is mandatory.

In the second case, use of is_assigned_to objects is or was not valid during the considered period.

is_assigned_to: the objects whose Effectivity are characterized by the assigned_effectivity.

role: the text that specifies the purpose of the association of the Effectivity with objects. For an Effectivity that identifies a period of time, if applicable, the following values shall be used:

  • 'actual': The assigned_effectivity defines a period of time during which the associated objects are or were effective;
  • 'planned': The assigned_effectivity defines a period of time during which the associated objects are or were expected to be effective;
  • 'required': The assigned_effectivity defines a period of time during which the associated objects are or were required to be effective.

4.2.86 Effectivity_relationship   

An Effectivity_relationship is a relationship between two Effectivity objects. The meaning of the relationship is represented by the relation_type attribute.

NOTE 1   Sometimes effectivity is not dependent on particular dates or serial numbers, but on the effectivity of other items. In this case end values are not instantiated, but are derived via an Effectivity_relationship to the reference Effectivity.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Effectivity_relationship;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  related : Effectivity;
  relating : Effectivity;
  relation_type : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

description: the text that provides further information about the Effectivity_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

related: the second of the two Effectivity objects related by the Effectivity_relationship.

NOTE 2   The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

relating: the first of the two Effectivity objects related by the Effectivity_relationship.

NOTE 3   The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

relation_type: the text that specifies the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable, the following values shall be used:

  • 'constraint': The domain of the related Effectivity shall be included in the domain of the relating Effectivity.
  • 'inheritance': The related Effectivity shall not have an 'end' specified, but inherits the effectivity values from the relating Effectivity.

4.2.87 Element_delivery   

An Element_delivery is a specification of the expected delivery of an Activity_assignment.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Element_delivery;
  associated_activity : Activity;
  deliverable_elements : SET[1:?] OF activity_assignment_select;
  destination : Organization;
  quantity : Value_with_unit;
  role : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

associated_activity: the Activity that this Element_delivery is a part of.

deliverable_elements: the Activity_assignment instances that are subject to the delivery.

destination: the Organization the Activity_assignment is to be delivered to.

quantity: the number of objects referred by the Activity_assignment to be delivered.

role: the text that describes the intention with this Element_delivery.

4.2.88 Evaluated_characteristic   

An Evaluated_characteristic is a set of properties resulting from an evaluation or intended evaluation of product data. The Evaluated_characteristic associates evaluation data with a Planned_characteristic for the purposes of traceability.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Evaluated_characteristic;
  actual_characteristics : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Property;
  evaluation_activity : OPTIONAL Activity;
  evaluation_result : evaluation_result_enum;
  evaluation_status : evaluation_status_enum;
  name : OPTIONAL STRING;
  planned_characteristic : Planned_characteristic;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

actual_characteristics: the Property values for an Evaluated_characteristic. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

evaluation_activity: the instance of Activity that describes details of the evaluation procedure. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

evaluation_result: the result of the evaluation for the Evaluated_characteristic. Where applicable, the following values shall be used:

  • 'fail': the evaluation has failed;
  • 'pass': the evaluation has passed;
  • 'undefined': the evaluation result is undefined.

evaluation_status: the value that describes the status of the evaluation. Where applicable, the following values shall be used:

  • 'invalid': the evaluation is not valid;
  • 'not evaluatable': the evaluation is not conclusive;
  • 'to be evaluated': the evaluation shall be performed;
  • ‘valid’: the evaluation is valid.

name: the words by which the Evaluated_characteristic is known. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

planned_characteristic: the Planned_characteristic object that the evaluation data relate to.

4.2.89 Event   

An Event is the fact of the existence of a state at some point in time.

NOTE 1   The event may have occurred or may be not yet started.

NOTE 2   The point in time where an event will start or started, may not be known or specified.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Event;
  actual_start_date : OPTIONAL Date_time;
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  event_type : STRING;
  id : Id_with_context;
  offset : OPTIONAL Duration;
  planned_start_date : OPTIONAL Date_time;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

actual_start_date: the actual_start_date specifies the date when the Event actually started. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

additional_ids: the other identifiers that distinguish the Event. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

description: the text that provides further information about the Event. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

event_type: specifies the kind of event.

EXAMPLE    The event_type may be the 'start of production' of a Product_class specified as 'event context'.

id: the identifier for the Event.

offset: specifies the amount of time before or after the defined Event that shall be used to calculate the actual point in time. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

planned_start_date: the Date_time when the Event is or was planned to start. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

4.2.90 Event_assignment   

An Event_assignment is the assignment of an Event to product or activity data.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Event_assignment;
  assigned_event : Event;
  is_assigned_to : SET[1:?] OF general_organizational_data_select;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

assigned_event: the Event to be assigned to product or activity data.

is_assigned_to: the product or activity data to which the Event is assigned.

4.2.91 Event_relationship   

An Event_relationship is a relationship which exists between two Event objects.

EXAMPLE    An instance of this entity data type with relation_type 'sequence' may be used to specify that an event shall end before another event starts.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Event_relationship;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  related : Event;
  relating : Event;
  relation_type : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

description: the text that provides further information about the Event_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

related: the other related instance of Event is a part of the relationship. If one element of the relationship is dependent upon the other, this attribute shall be the dependent one.

relating: one of the instances of Event that is a part of the relationship.

relation_type: the string that defines the kind of relationship that is specified. Where applicable, the following values shall be used:

  • 'actualization': The relationship specifies that the relating Event identifies a predicted or planned event and the related Event identifies the point in time when that event actually occurred. This relationship is valid if the actual_start_date attribute of the relating Event is not specified and the actual_start_date attribute of the related Event is specified, or, if both these attributes are specified and equal;
  • 'exclusiveness': The relationship specifies that the relating and the related Event shall not have any overlap during their duration;
  • 'sequence': The relationship specifies that the relating Event shall be completed before the related Event starts;
  • 'simultaneity': The relationship specifies that both the relating and related Event are considered as occurring during the same time period or shall be performed together in order to ensure consistency and enhance efficiency.

    NOTE    The criteria for 'simultaneity' and in particular the allowed delay between two events declared simultaneous, are user-dependent.

4.2.92 Explicit_transformation_2d   

An Explicit_transformation_2d is a geometric in two-dimensional space where the translation and rotation is explicitly defined.

An Explicit_transformation_2d is a type of Transformation_2d.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Explicit_transformation_2d
  SUBTYPE OF (Transformation_2d);
  axis1 : OPTIONAL Direction;
  axis2 : OPTIONAL Direction;
  local_origin : Cartesian_point;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

axis1: the X axis direction. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

axis2: the Y axis direction. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

local_origin: the required translation. The actual translation includes in the transformation is from the geometric origin to the local origin.

4.2.93 Explicit_transformation_3d   

An Explicit_transformation_3d is a transformation in three-dimensional space where the translation and rotation is explicitly defined.

An Explicit_transformation_3d is a type of Transformation_3d.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Explicit_transformation_3d
  SUBTYPE OF (Transformation_3d);
  axis1 : OPTIONAL Direction;
  axis2 : OPTIONAL Direction;
  axis3 : OPTIONAL Direction;
  local_origin : Cartesian_point;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

axis1: the X axis direction. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

axis2: the Y axis direction. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

axis3: the Z axis direction. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

local_origin: the required translation. The actual translation includes in the transformation is from the geometric origin to the local origin.

4.2.94 External_class   

An External_class is a type of classification that represents a reference to a class that is not included in the data exchange file and is defined in an External_class_library.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY External_class;
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  id : Id_with_context;
  name : OPTIONAL STRING;
  source : External_class_library;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: other identifiers that may be used to distinguish the External_class. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

description: the text that provides further information about the External_class. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

id: the identifier for the External_class.

name: the words by which the External_class is known. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

source: the identification of the External_class_library that provides the definition for the External_class.

4.2.95 External_class_assignment   

A External_class_assignment is an object that associates a External_class with one or more objects.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY External_class_assignment;
  assigned_external_class : External_class;
  is_assigned_to : SET[1:?] OF classified_element_select;
  role : OPTIONAL STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

assigned_external_class: the External_class object that provides classification information.

is_assigned_to: the objects that are classified.

role: the meaning of the relationship between the assigned_external_class and the objects that are classified. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

NOTE    When there is a specific role, the assignment has extra information that can be useful to differentiate this assignment from others.When all the items are assigned to the same External_class in the same way there is no need to specify a role. Just when it is needed to distinguish them, the role attribute is useful.

EXAMPLE 1   The role for 'electromagnetic compatibility' has the associated object that is a classification that categorizes the classified element in respect of its ability to comply with requirements concerning electromagnetic interference.

EXAMPLE 2   The role for 'environmental conditions' has the associated object that is a classification that categorizes the classified element in respect of its ability to comply with environmental impact requirements.

4.2.96 External_class_library   

A External_class_library is a type of External_source. An External_class_library is the identification of an external class library.

EXAMPLE    A dictionary collecting the conventional definitions of technical properties is an example of External_class_library.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY External_class_library
  SUBTYPE OF (External_source);
END_ENTITY;
(*

4.2.97 External_geometric_model   

An External_geometric_model is a type of External_model that contains geometry in a three-dimensional context only.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY External_geometric_model
  SUBTYPE OF (External_model);
  accuracy_type : OPTIONAL STRING;
  accuracy_value : OPTIONAL REAL;
  model_extent : OPTIONAL Numerical_value;
  parameter_values : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Simple_property;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

accuracy_type: the kind of accuracy that is applied. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • 'angular accuracy': A kind of accuracy that specifies the maximum value for the absolute angle between two curve tangents or two surface normals for which the creating system assumes curve tangents or surface normals being identical

    NOTE 1   The angular accuracy value can be used to determine the accuracy range for tangent continuous curve or surface connections.

  • 'curvature accuracy': A kind of accuracy that specifies the value for the term under which a system can assume that the two radii of curvature R1 and R2 are identical. The curvature accuracy value is used to determine the accuracy range for curvature continuous curve or surface connections

    NOTE 2   Terms surrounded by the FORMULA symbols represent the absolute values of these terms.

  • 'distance accuracy': A kind of accuracy that specifies the distance under which two points can be considered as having the same location. The distance accuracy value defined for a Geometric_model is valid for all geometric elements of the Geometric_model.

The value of this attribute need not be specified.

accuracy_value: a numerical value defining the accuracy of the model. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

model_extent: the radius of a sphere that contains all elements of the model and whose centre is at the origin of the Cartesian_coordinate_space of the External_geometric_model. The model_extent is specified using a length unit. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

parameter_values: the Simple_property object or group of Simple_property objects that may be varied in each occurrence. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.98 External_item_identification   

A External_item_identification is a type of External_source_identification that provides the identifier of an item in the context of an external source where it can be found.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY External_item_identification
  SUPERTYPE OF (File_location_identification)
  SUBTYPE OF (External_source_identification);
  external_id : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

external_id: the identifier of the external item, in its external context.

EXAMPLE 1   For a digital file, the file name of a file in the directory where it is located is an example of external_id.

EXAMPLE 2   For a book, the external_id could be the ISBN number.

4.2.99 External_model   

A External_model is the identification of a model that is described in a Digital_file and by the Cartesian_coordinate_space that is needed to further process the externally described information.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY External_model
  ABSTRACT SUPERTYPE OF (ONEOF (External_geometric_model,
                                External_picture));
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  id : Id_with_context;
  is_defined_as : Digital_file;
  is_defined_in : Cartesian_coordinate_space;
  name : OPTIONAL STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: other identifiers that may be used to distinguish the External_model. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

description: the text that provides further information about the External_model. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

id: the identifier for the External_model.

is_defined_as: the Digital_file that contains the externally defined geometry information.

is_defined_in: the Cartesian_coordinate_space that defines the context for the externally described geometry.

name: the words by which the External_model is known. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.100 External_model_relationship   

A External_model_relationship is a relationship between two external models.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY External_model_relationship;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  placement : OPTIONAL Transformation;
  related : External_model;
  relating : External_model;
  relation_type : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

description: the text that provides further information about the External_model_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

placement: the geometric Transformation that places and orients the related model relative to the relating model. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

related: the second of the two model objects related by the External_model_relationship.

NOTE 1   The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

relating: the first of the two model objects related by the External_model_relationship.

NOTE 2   The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

relation_type: the meaning of the relationship.

EXAMPLE    The relation_type may be, e.g., 'basis for' if the relating Geometric_model provides a detailed representation of the shape of an object and if the related Geometric_model provides an idealized representation of the shape of the same object.

4.2.101 External_picture   

An External_picture is a type of External_model that is described by a two dimensional image.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY External_picture
  SUBTYPE OF (External_model);
  SELF\External_model.is_defined_in : Cartesian_coordinate_space_2d;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

is_defined_in: the Cartesian_coordinate_space_2d that defines the context for the externally defined geometry. For picture formats having no explicit origin, e.g., raster format, the lower left corner is defined as the origin of the picture, the x-axis pointing to the right, the y-axis pointing to the top.

4.2.102 External_source   

An External_source is a

EXPRESS specification:

*)
