id: the identifier for the External_source.

4.2.103 External_source_identification   

An External_source_identification is the specification of the location of a file in an external storage system.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY External_source_identification
  SUPERTYPE OF (ONEOF (Document_location_identification,
                       External_item_identification));
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  source_id : STRING;
  source_type : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

description: the text that provides further information about the External_source_identification. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

source_id: the text that identifies the context in which the external id is specified.

EXAMPLE 1   For a digital file identified by a filename and directory path, the source_id is the directory path.

source_type: the text that identifies the identification scheme of the source_id.

EXAMPLE 2   In the case of files, examples of source_type are:

  • 'URL' - for a web page;
  • 'FTP' - for an FTP address;
  • 'ISBN' - for physical documents.

4.2.104 File   

A File is one of potentially more files on a computer system or in actual stacks of paper that make up a Document_definition.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY File
  ABSTRACT SUPERTYPE OF (ONEOF (Digital_file,
                                Hardcopy));
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  content : OPTIONAL Document_content_property;
  creation : OPTIONAL Document_creation_property;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  file_format : OPTIONAL Document_format_property;
  file_type : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Document_type_property;
  id : Id_with_context;
  ids_and_locations : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF File_location_identification;
  size : OPTIONAL Document_size_property;
  version_id : OPTIONAL STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: other identifiers that may be used to distinguish the File. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

content: the content of the File. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

creation: further details of the context of the creation of the File. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

description: the text that provides further information about the File. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

file_format: the characteristics of the File that specify the format of the object. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

file_type: the format of the File. It shall only be specified, if the File does not participate in a Document. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

id: the identifier for the File.

ids_and_locations: alternatives of the identifier and location of the File.

EXAMPLE    A copy of a document may be found in another department with a different id.

The value of this attribute need not be specified.

size: the characteristics for the size of the File. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

version_id: the identification of the version that distinguishes one File object from other versions of File objects with the same id. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.105 File_location_identification   

A File_location_identification is a type of External_source_identification that specifies the location of a file in an external storage system.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY File_location_identification
  SUBTYPE OF (External_item_identification);
END_ENTITY;
(*

4.2.106 File_relationship   

A File_relationship is a relationship between two File objects. It specifies that the related File is referenced from the relating File.

EXAMPLE 1   A service manual may contain graphics for explanatory reasons. In this case the File objects that contain the graphics are referenced as related from the File object that contains the body of the service manual with relation_type 'reference'.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY File_relationship;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  related : File;
  relating : File;
  relation_type : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

description: the text that provides further information about the File_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

related: the second of the two objects related by the File_relationship.

NOTE 1   The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

relating: the first of the two objects related by the File_relationship.

NOTE 2   The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

relation_type: the meaning of the relationship. The values 'addition', 'decomposition', and 'peer' are only allowed if neither the relating nor the related File are included in a Document_definition. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • 'addition': The application object specifies that the related document provides supplementary or collateral information with regard to the information provided by the relating document;

    EXAMPLE 2   The recommended practices for this part of ISO 10303 may be an addition.

  • 'copy': The application object defines a relationship where the related File is a copy of the relating File;
  • 'decomposition': The application object defines a relationship where the related File is one of potentially more sub documents of the relating File;

    EXAMPLE 3   The decomposition of a document into clauses or into several CAD models is an example for 'decomposition'.

  • 'derivation': The business object defines a relationship where the related File is derived from the relating File;

    EXAMPLE 4   The derivation of a hypertext document from an text document is an example for 'derivation'.

  • 'peer': The application object specifies that the related document provides required information with regard to that provided by the relating document. The peer document is essential for a complete understanding;
  • 'reference': The application object defines a relationship where the related document is referenced from the relating one;

    EXAMPLE 5   The link in a hypertext document may be a reference.

  • 'sequence': The application object defines a logical sequence where the related File comes after the relating File;

    EXAMPLE 6   A sequence of clauses is an example for 'sequence'.

  • 'substitution': The application object defines a relationship where the related File replaces the relating File;
  • 'translation': The application object specifies that the related document is generated through a translation process from the relating document.

The values 'addition', 'decomposition', and 'peer' are used for the purpose of creating logical structures of documents. These values shall only be used for the relation_type of File_relationship, if the referenced File objects do not participate in a Document_definition. In the latter case, Document_definition_relationship shall be used instead.

4.2.107 Final_solution   

A Final_solution is a type of Alternative_solution and is a set of additional sensual characteristics that can be applied to a Part_instance that represents a neutral part in order to complete its definition.

EXAMPLE 1   In the case of a car body, the neutral parts are parts without paint; the final parts are the parts with paint. In the case of a seat, the neutral part is the seat with unspecified cover material; the final part may be the seat covered with red leather.

NOTE 1   A Final_solution may be associated with a Part_instance that represents the finalized part through a Realization_or_occurrence_relationship.

NOTE 2   The information common to all final solutions based on the same neutral part may identified by use of instances of Make_from_relationship.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Final_solution
  SUBTYPE OF (Alternative_solution);
  specifications : SET[1:?] OF final_definition_select;
  status : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

specifications: the set of means of finalization that are applied to the neutral part and which may be objects of type Part_version, Part_version_view, Physical_instance or Text_specification.

EXAMPLE 2   The specifications may be the Part_version_view objects of a certain kind of paint.

NOTE 3   The Part_version_view that is referenced here, is not a view of the Part that results from the finalization. The Part that results from the finalization, e.g., a Part with colour, is identified by an association between Final_solution and Part_instance through a Realization_or_occurrence_relationship.

status: the text string that describes the level of completion between the neutral part and the final part.

EXAMPLE 3   'final for shipping overseas', 'final for transport by truck', or 'final for sale' are examples for status.

4.2.108 Functional_breakdown   

A Functional_breakdown is a type of Breakdown that identifies a partitioning of a product into a set of Functional_breakdown_element objects. A Functional_breakdown is a view of the functions of a product by means of parent-child relationships. Not all functions of the product need to be included in a Functional_breakdown.

NOTE    Parent-child relationships are represented by Functional_breakdown_element_decomposition_relationship objects.

EXAMPLE    A functional breakdown may provide a decomposition of an aircraft in terms of high-level functional processes such as flight, taxiing and at rest all the way down to low-level processes such as detect on board fuel level, move tail rudder and provide standard tow attachment point.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Functional_breakdown
  SUBTYPE OF (Breakdown);
END_ENTITY;
(*

Informal propositions:

IP1: All elements of a Functional_breakdown shall be of type Functional_breakdown_element.

4.2.109 Functional_breakdown_element   

A Functional_breakdown_element is a type of Breakdown_element that identifies an element that is included in one or more Functional_breakdown objects.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Functional_breakdown_element
  SUBTYPE OF (Breakdown_element);
END_ENTITY;
(*

4.2.110 Functional_breakdown_element_association   

A Functional_breakdown_element_association is a relationship between a Functional_breakdown_element and an item that realizes that element definition, that is, either an Alternative_solution, a Part_version, a Part_version_viewor a Physical_breakdown_element.

EXAMPLE 1   A pump realizes the 'provide fuel to engine' element in a functional breakdown for a ship.

EXAMPLE 2   The functional element 'heat dissipation' may be one of the functions that are fulfilled by any technical solution for the physical element 'braking system'.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Functional_breakdown_element_association;
  associated_functional_element : Functional_breakdown_element;
  associated_physical_element : physical_element_select;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

associated_functional_element: the Functional_breakdown_element of this association.

associated_physical_element: an Alternative_solution, a Part_version, a Part_version_view or a Physical_breakdown_element that shall be associated with the associated_functional_element.

4.2.111 Functional_breakdown_element_decomposition_relationship   

A Functional_breakdown_element_decomposition_relationship is a relationship between a parent Functional_breakdown_element and a child Functional_breakdown_element.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Functional_breakdown_element_decomposition_relationship;
  related : Functional_breakdown_element;
  relating : Functional_breakdown_element;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

related: the child Functional_breakdown_element object of the relationship.

relating: the parent Functional_breakdown_element object of the relationship.

4.2.112 Functional_breakdown_element_relationship   

A Functional_breakdown_element_relationship is a relationship between two Functional_breakdown_element objects the meaning of which is defined by the attribute relation_type.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Functional_breakdown_element_relationship;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  related : Functional_breakdown_element;
  relating : Functional_breakdown_element;
  relation_type : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

description: the text that provides further information about the Functional_breakdown_element_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

related: the second of the two Functional_breakdown_element objects related by the Functional_breakdown_element_relationship.

NOTE 1   The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

relating: the first of the two Functional_breakdown_element objects related by the Functional_breakdown_element_relationship.

NOTE 2   The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

relation_type: the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable, the following values shall be used:

  • 'decomposition': The related Functional_breakdown_element is one of potentially more components of the relating Functional_breakdown_element.

    NOTE 3   This case is identical to the functionality of Functional_breakdown_element_decomposition_relationship that should be used preferably.

  • 'specialization': The related Functional_breakdown_element fulfils the requirements of the relating Functional_breakdown_element in a more specific way than defined for the relating Functional_breakdown_element.

4.2.113 General_assembly_component_relationship   

A General_assembly_component_relationship is a relationship between a an Assembly_definition and a Part_instance representing a constituent of the assembly whose meaning is defined by the attribute relation_type.

A General_assembly_component_relationship is a type of Assembly_component_relationship.

*)

relation_type: the meaning of the relationship.

4.2.114 General_breakdown   

A General_breakdown is a type of Breakdown that identifies a partitioning of a product into a set of General_breakdown_element objects. A General_breakdown is a view of the structure of a product by means of parent-child relationships.

NOTE    Parent-child relationships are represented by General_breakdown_element_decomposition_relationship objects.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY General_breakdown
  SUBTYPE OF (Breakdown);
  breakdown_type : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

breakdown_type: the kind of Breakdown that is represented by the General_breakdown.

Informal propositions:

IP1: A General_breakdown shall not represent functional or physical breakdowns; use Functional_breakdown and Physical_breakdown instead.

IP2: All elements of a General_breakdown shall be of type General_breakdown_element.

4.2.115 General_breakdown_element   

A General_breakdown_element is a type of Breakdown_elementthat identifies an element that is included in one or more General_breakdown objects.

EXPRESS specification:

*)

  breakdown_element_type : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

breakdown_element_type: the kind of Breakdown_element that is represented by the General_breakdown.

Informal propositions:

IP1: The meaning of the value of breakdown_element_type shall be consistent with the meaning of the values of the breakdown_type attributes of the General_breakdown objects that include this General_breakdown_element.

4.2.116 General_breakdown_element_decomposition_relationship

4.2.117 General_breakdown_element_relationship   

A General_breakdown_element_relationship is a relationship between two General_breakdown_element objects the meaning of which is defined by the attribute relation_type.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY General_breakdown_element_relationship;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  related : General_breakdown_element;
  relating : General_breakdown_element;
  relation_type : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

description: the text that provides further information about the General_breakdown_element_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

related: the second of the two General_breakdown_element objects related by the General_breakdown_element_relationship.

NOTE 1   The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

relating: the first of the two General_breakdown_element objects related by the General_breakdown_element_relationship.

NOTE 2   The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

relation_type: the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable, the following values shall be used:

  • 'decomposition': The related General_breakdown_element is one of potentially more components of the relating General_breakdown_element.

    NOTE 3   This case is identical to the functionality of General_breakdown_element_decomposition_relationship that should be used preferably.

  • 'specialization': The related General_breakdown_element fulfils the requirements of the relating General_breakdown_element in a more specific way than defined for the relating General_breakdown_element.

4.2.118 General_part_instance_relationship   

A General_part_instance_relationship is a type of Part_instance_relationship that relationship between two Part_instance objects the meaning of which is defined by the attribute relation_type.

EXAMPLE    The relationship between a door and the adjacent parts of the car body (like A-column or roof) that defines the actual gap, is an example for a General_part_instance_relationship.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY General_part_instance_relationship
  SUBTYPE OF (Part_instance_relationship);
  relation_type : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

relation_type: the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • 'usage replacement': the related object is the replacement of the relating object;
  • 'same time machining': both Part_instance objects result from the same manufacturing operation.

4.2.119 General_part_version_view   

A General_part_version_view is a type of Part_version_view. The characterization is specified by the attribute view_type.

EXPRESS specification:

*)

  view_type : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

view_type: specifies the kind of view the General_part_version_view defines. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • 'not specific': The object is considered as not specific of any view.

4.2.120 General_part_version_view_instance_relationship   

A General_part_version_view_instance_relationship is a type of Part_version_view_instance_relationship that is a relationship between a Part_version_view and a Part_instance whose meaning is defined by the attribute relation_type.

EXAMPLE    The relationship between the definition (Part_version_view) of a rubber gasket and the instances (Part_instance) of the doors the gasket is used for, is an example for a General_part_version_view_instance_relationship. In this case the relationship gives information that the length of the gasket depends on the actual shape of each door.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY General_part_version_view_instance_relationship
  SUBTYPE OF (Part_version_view_instance_relationship);
  relation_type : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

relation_type: the meaning of the relationship.

4.2.121 General_part_version_view_relationship   

A General_part_version_view_relationship is a type of Part_version_view_relationship whose meaning is defined by the attribute relation_type.

EXAMPLE    The functional and shape dependencies between a part of a door lock mounted on the door and the corresponding part mounted on the car body, is an example for a General_part_instance_relationship.

4.2.124 General_shape_dependent_property   

A General_shape_dependent_property is a type of Shape_dependent_property that defines a user-defined characteristic of an object. The Property_value specified by a General_shape_dependent_property is derived from geometry.

NOTE    The General_shape_dependent_property may be used for the purpose of validation of geometric models.

EXAMPLE 1   If a geometry model is exchanged between two partners, the calculation of various properties of the bodies, such as centre of mass, overall surface, or overall volume, is performed by originator and recipient. When comparing these set of values, the existence of deficiencies in the received model can be easily detected.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY General_shape_dependent_property
  SUBTYPE OF (Shape_dependent_property);
  property_type : STRING;
  property_value : property_value_select;
  unit : OPTIONAL Unit;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

property_type: the type of characteristic that is specified for an object. The following values shall be used:

  • 'centroid': The Property_value identifies the centre point of the mass of a body. The relative position of this point within the body is an invariant datum relative to rotation and translation.;

    EXAMPLE 2   An example, where the use of this General_shape_dependent_property with property_type 'centroid' is used instead of the object Centre_of_mass, is the following: sometimes the General_shape_dependent_property is calculated by some system at some point of time. But there are cases where the information, e.g., the General_shape_dependent_property of a die, is transferred into a following stage, e.g., in order to perform a feasibility check, where there is only a simplified shape representation that does not allow to calculate the exact General_shape_dependent_property. Yet, in this stage the information about the General_shape_dependent_property is needed in order to check whether the transport of a die with a crane is feasible.

  • 'surface area': The Property_value specifies the overall surface of the bodies contained in the referenced shape.;
  • 'volume': The Property_value specifies the overall volume of the bodies contained in the referenced shape.

property_value: the value that is given for a particular characteristic.

unit: the unit in which the General_shape_dependent_property is expressed. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.125 Geometric_model   

A Geometric_model is a representation of geometry.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Geometric_model ABSTRACT
  ABSTRACT SUPERTYPE ;
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  geometry_type : SET[1:?] OF STRING;
  id : Id_with_context;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: the additional identifiers that distinguish the Geometric_model. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

geometry_type: the kind of geometry defined by the Geometric_model.

NOTE    The business object model does not further specialize Geometric_model subtypes. The differentiation between different types of geometry is realized by the geometry_type attribute.

EXAMPLE    Examples for geometry_type are 'wireframe model 3d', 'point direction model', 'wireframe model 2d', 'hybrid geometric model 3d', 'geometrically bounded surface model', 'surface model', 'compound model', 'csg model', 'b rep model', or 'faceted b rep model'.

id: the identifier for the Geometric_model.

4.2.126 Geometrical_relationship   

A Geometrical_relationship is a type of Part_version_view_relationship. A Geometrical_relationship is the relationship between two Part_version_view_relationship objects specifying two parts that are geometrically related. Therefore, the shape of the related parts may be represented only once and can be reused for the geometrically related situation. In this case the shape of the relating Part_version_view is derived from the shape of the related Part_version_view.

The two Part_version_view_relationship objects that are related by this relationship shall belong to different Part_version objects. Other properties except shape are not subject to this relationship and therefore are not 'inherited' from the related Part_version_view to the relating Part_version_view .

EXAMPLE    The following figure shows an example for a Geometrical_relationship: in this case the left mudguard of a car is symmetrical to the right mudguard. A given plane mirroring transformation specifies the location of the left mudguard regarding the location of the right mudguard.




Figure 2 —  Mudguard illustration of Geometrical_relationship

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Geometrical_relationship
  SUBTYPE OF (Part_version_view_relationship);
  placement : transformation_select;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

placement: the External_model_relationship or the Template_instance that has the Transformation to be applied to the related Part_version_view in order to define the location and the orientation within the context of the relating Part_version_view. Translation, rotation, and mirroring, i.e., inversion, is included; scaling is not included. In the case of a Template_instance, the scale factor shall be set to 1.0 .

4.2.127 Hardcopy   

A Hardcopy is a type of File that is the actual stack of paper consisting of one or more sheets, on which some product data is written, printed or plotted.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Hardcopy
  SUBTYPE OF (File);
END_ENTITY;
(*

role: specifies further details for the context information. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.129 Implicit_transformation_2d   

An Implicit_transformation_2d is a type of Transformation_2d that is a transformation that is defined by two instances of Axis2_placement_2d in which one instance of Axis2_placement_2d is the result of applying the transformation function to the other. The transformation function is not explicitly provided, but it is derived from the relationship between the instances of Axis2_placement_2d. The transformation between the two instances of Axis2_placement_2d applies to every element in the objects related by the Implicit_transformation_2d.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Implicit_transformation_2d
  SUBTYPE OF (Transformation_2d);
  origin : Axis2_placement_2d;
  target : Axis2_placement_2d;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

origin: the Axis2_placement_2d defining the origin of the transformation.

target: the Axis2_placement_2d defining the target of the transformation.

4.2.130 Implicit_transformation_3d   

An Implicit_transformation_3d is a transformation that is defined by two instances of Axis2_placement_3d in which one instance of Axis2_placement_3d is the result of applying the transformation function to the other. The transformation function is not explicitly provided, but it is derived from the relationship between the instances of Axis2_placement_3d. The transformation between the two instances of Axis2_placement_3d applies to every element in the objects related by the Implicit_transformation_3d. An Implicit_transformation_3d is a type of Transformation_3d.

*)

target: the Axis2_placement_3d defining the target of the transformation.

4.2.131 Information_right   

An Information_right is a definition of what may or may not be done with an item of information in the sense of legal rights and obligations.

EXAMPLE 1   Copyright is an Information_right.

EXAMPLE 2   For the purposes of developing a new system, details of government furnished equipment may be made available to a particular project team. The team may copy and use the information internally, but may not pass it on, either to a third part, or to another team, and must destroy the information at the end of the contract.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Information_right
  SUPERTYPE OF (Copyright);
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  id : Id_with_context;
  name : STRING;
  owners : SET[1:?] OF person_organization_select;
  restriction : OPTIONAL STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: the additional identifiers that distinguishes the Information_right. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

description: the text that provides further information about the Information_right. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

id: the identifier for the Information_right.

name: the words by which the Information_right is known.

owners: the set of Organization or Person_in_organization objects that own the Information_right.

restriction: the text that describes any conditions and limitations that apply to the exercise of the right. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

EXAMPLE 3   The description of the right states that copying is permitted within the project team only, whereas the restriction notes the additional constraint that the information must be destroyed at the end of the project.

4.2.132 Information_usage_right   

An Information_usage_right is an application an Information_right to a particular usage context.

NOTE 1   One view of the distinction between an Information_right and an Information_usage_right is that the Information_right represents a standard clause in a contract, whereas an Information_usage_right represents the fact that the clause is used in a particular contract.

NOTE 2   The context for the usage can be defined through the contract which defines the right, the organization that grants the right, the person or organization which is granted the right, and any dates such as the starting or ending dates for the right. The meaning of each association is identified through the roles of the assignments, and these are defined through reference data.

NOTE 3   The Approval of an Information_usage_right carries the meaning that the right is granted to all information items in the relevant context, as opposed to the approval of an Information_usage_right_assignment which is limited to particular items.

NOTE 4   Information_usage_right provides a mechanism for recording significant rights within a product database. The legal significance of the presence or absence of a right is outside the scope of this part of ISO 10303.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Information_usage_right;
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  grants_right : SET[1:?] OF Information_right;
  id : Id_with_context;
  name : STRING;
  owners : SET[1:?] OF person_organization_select;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: the additional identifiers that distinguishes the Information_usage_right. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

description: the text that provides further information about the Information_usage_right. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

grants_right: the set of Information_right granted under this usage.

id: the identifier for the Information_usage_right.

name: the words by which the Information_usage_right is known.

owners: the set of Organization or Person_in_organization objects that own the Information_usage_right.

4.2.133 Information_usage_right_assignment   

An Information_usage_right_assignment is an assignment of a particular usage right to a set of items.

NOTE    If an approval is applied to this entity, it carries the meaning that the particular set of items is approved for the given usage. This approval generally indicates that the approval is exceptional, for example, where the information belongs to another project, and that project agrees to share some particular items of information. There is a further implication that the set of entities should not be changed once the approval is given.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Information_usage_right_assignment;
  assigned_right : Information_usage_right;
  is_assigned_to : SET[1:?] OF information_usage_right_select;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

assigned_right: the right which is assigned to the items.

is_assigned_to: the set of information usage right items to which the usage right applies.

4.2.134 Information_usage_right_relationship   

An Information_usage_right_relationship is a relationship of one Information_usage_right to another.

EXAMPLE    Where one Information_usage_right supersedes another, then the original right is pointed to by the relating attribute, its replacement by the related attribute, and the relation_type attribute takes the value supersedes.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Information_usage_right_relationship;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  related : Information_usage_right;
  relating : Information_usage_right;
  relation_type : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

description: the text that provides further information about the Information_usage_right_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

related: one of the instances of Information_usage_right that is a part of the relationship.

relating: the other instance of Information_usage_right that is a part of the relationship. If one Information_usage_right participating in the relationship is dependent upon the other, this attribute shall be the dependent one.

relation_type: a role that defines the behaviour of the relationship.

4.2.135 Instance_placement   

An Instance_placement is a the specification of the placement of a Single_part_instance that is defined in its own Cartesian_coordinate_space, in the coordinate space of a reference Physical_breakdown_element.

NOTE 1   A Physical_breakdown_element may be placed by a transformation using Model_property_assignment.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Instance_placement;
  placed_instance : Single_part_instance;
  placement : transformation_select;
  reference_component : Physical_breakdown_element;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

placed_instance: the Single_part_instance that is placed. The coordinate system is defined by the Geometric_model or External_geometric_model that represents the shape of the placed_instance.

NOTE 2   If the shape of thePart_instance is not different from the shape of the Part_version_view referred to by the instance of Part_shape, the Geometric_model representing this shape is shared.

placement: the External_model_relationship or the Template_instance that defines the position of the placed_instance relative to the reference_component. In the case of Template_instance, the scale shall be omitted or set to 1.0.

The Geometric_model associated with the reference_component shall contain Axis_placement objects to locate all related placed components and may contain additional instances of geometric entities to describe shape aspects that are relevant in the context of the reference_component.

EXAMPLE    The Geometric_model associated with the reference_component 'car engine' may contain Axis_placement objects that locate the gear box and the crankshaft and additional geometric information that represent the envelope box that is allowed for the car engine.

reference_component: the Physical_breakdown_element that specifies indirectly the reference coordinate space. The coordinate system of the reference_component that serves as a reference for the placement shall be specified by an External_geometric_model or a Geometric_model referenced by a Model_property_assignment. The definition of the Model_property shall be a General_property_definition with a text string for property_type equal 'positioning'. Alternatively the coordinate system is defined by the shape of the reference_component.

Informal propositions:

IP1: The Geometric_model or External_geometric_model that is referred to indirectly by the placement attribute shall be associated with the placed_component Single_part_instance through an object of Shape_description_association and an object of Part_shape that is referenced through is_defining_shape_for.

4.2.136 Kinematic_path_defined_by_nodes   

A Kinematic_path_defined_by_nodes is a path or a segment of a path along which motion is to take place. The path is defined by nodes. Nodes are start points and endpoints of paths or segments and points where segments meet. No more than two segments meet in the same node. The Kinematic_path_defined_by_nodes has its own t parameter range; the segments are re-parametrised in such a way that the sum of the lengths of their individual t parameter ranges fits the length of the parameter range of the Kinematic_path_defined_by_nodes, and the ratio between the lengths of the individual parameter ranges remains unchanged.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Kinematic_path_defined_by_nodes;
  name : OPTIONAL STRING;
  placement_start : Axis_placement;
  representation_context : Cartesian_coordinate_space;
  segments : LIST[1:?] OF Path_segment;
  t_start : REAL;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

name: the words by which the Kinematic_path_defined_by_nodes is known. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

placement_start: the Axis_placement that defines the reference coordinate system and, thus, the location and orientation of the start-point of the Kinematic_path_defined_by_nodes Axis_placement that defines the reference coordinate system and, thus, the location and orientation of the start-point of the Kinematic_path_defined_by_nodes.

representation_context: the Cartesian_coordinate_space that defines the units of measures for the Kinematic_path_defined_by_nodes.

segments: the ordered list of Path_segment objects that the Kinematic_path_defined_by_nodes consists of. The travel along the Kinematic_path_defined_by_nodes starts at the first element in the list.

t_start: the parameter value that represents the start location of a travel along the Kinematic_path_defined_by_nodes.

4.2.137 Language   

A Language is a specification of the language in which an information object is given.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Language;
  country_code : OPTIONAL STRING;
  language_code : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

country_code: the country, as addition to the language. The alpha-2 code as specified in ISO 3166-1 shall be used. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

EXAMPLE 1   Possible values for country_code are, e.g., 'GB' for the United Kingdom or 'US' for the United States of America.

language_code: the language of the text information. The Alpha-3 bibliographic code as specified in ISO 639-2 shall be used.

EXAMPLE 2   Possible values for language_code are, e.g., 'eng' for English, 'fre' for French, 'rus' for Russian, or 'ger' for German.

4.2.138 Language_indication   

A Language_indication is an identification of the Language in which a text attribute of one or more instances has been specified.

NOTE    The Language_indication entity data type identifies the primary language of a text attribute while the Attribute_translation_assignment entity data type enables to convey the translations of that attribute in various languages.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Language_indication;
  attribute : STRING;
  instance : string_select;
  language : Language;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

attribute: the name of the attribute the Language of which has been identified.

instance: the instance for which the Language of the attribute has been identified.

language: the Language used to write the text attribute of the instance.

4.2.141 Link_motion_along_path

4.2.147 Make_from_relationship   

A Make_from_relationship is a type of Part_version_view_relationship that is a relationship between a Part_version_view which provides the definition of a raw material, or of a semi-finished part and a Part_version_view which provides the definition of an object manufactured out of that material, or semi-finished part. The inherited attribute related specifies the raw material or the semi-finished part, and the inherited attribute relating specifies the manufactured part.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Make_from_relationship
  SUBTYPE OF (Part_version_view_relationship);
  priority : OPTIONAL INTEGER;
  quantity : OPTIONAL Value_with_unit;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

priority: an integer that ranks the preference for use of the related Part_version among all instances of Make_from_relationship that have the same value for the inherited relating attribute. This value is an integer that only has meaning when comparing it with corresponding values for Make_from_relationship sharing the same relating Part_version_view object. It is a relative ranking value, not an absolute ranking. A lower value indicates a higher preference for the related Part_version_view object, and a higher value indicates a lower preference. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

quantity: the Value_with_unit that specifies the amount of the related Part_version that is used to produce the relating Part_version. The value of this attribute need not be specified; it may be specified when the related Part_version is a countable material.

4.2.148 Manufacturing_configuration   

A Manufacturing_configuration is an association of a Product_design_association with a Part_instance. Each Manufacturing_configuration is a Serial_configuration, a Dated_configuration, a Time_interval_configuration, or a Lot_configuration.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Manufacturing_configuration
  ABSTRACT SUPERTYPE OF (ONEOF (Dated_configuration,
                                Lot_configuration,
                                Serial_configuration,
                                Time_interval_configuration));
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  concerned_organizations : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Organization;
  configured_element : Part_instance;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  id : OPTIONAL Id_with_context;
  is_solution_for : Product_design_association;
  name : OPTIONAL STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: other identifiers that may be used to distinguish the Manufacturing_configuration. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

concerned_organizations: the set of Organization objects in which the Manufacturing_configuration is valid. The value of this attribute need not be specified. In the case where the concerned_organizations is not set means that the Manufacturing_configuration regards any organization that may consider the configured_element.

configured_element: a Part_instance that is controlled by a Manufacturing_configuration.

description: the text that provides further information about the Manufacturing_configuration. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

id: the identifier for the Manufacturing_configuration. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

is_solution_for: the Product_design_association for which the Part_instance is configured.

name: the words by which the Manufacturing_configuration is known. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.149 Mass_property_definition   

A Mass_property_definition is a type of Property_definition that is a quantity of matter that an object consists of.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Mass_property_definition
  SUBTYPE OF (Property_definition);
END_ENTITY;
(*

4.2.150 Mated_part_association   

A Mated_part_association is a type of Assembly_component_relationship between a Mating_definition and a Part_instance that is used within the Mating_definition.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Mated_part_association
  SUBTYPE OF (Assembly_component_relationship);
END_ENTITY;
(*

4.2.151 Mated_part_relationship   

A Mated_part_relationship is a relationship between two Mated_part_association objects. This relationship specifies additional information about the mating of two particular items that go into a Mating_definition. The two Mated_part_association objects that are referenced by the Mated_part_relationship shall refer to the same Mating_definition.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Mated_part_relationship;

mating_materials: the set of Quantified_part_instance objects used as material for the mating. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

related: the second of the two Mated_part_association objects related by the Mated_part_relationship.

relating: the first of the two Mated_part_association objects related by the Mated_part_relationship.

4.2.152 Material_identification   

A Material_identification is an identification of the substance out of that one or more Part objects are or can be made.

EXAMPLE    The entity Part can be used to represent a raw material part, before it is used to manufacture products. The entity Material_identification would provide the name of the material for that Part.

For the specification of the raw material from that a part is made, the object Part is used with an attached Part_category with classification type 'raw material'. That object represents the material item with possibly additional information, like identification of supplier, quantity, size of the raw stock etc. and it can be used in corresponding relationships such as Make_from_relationship or for a Process_operation_definition.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Material_identification;
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  id : Id_with_context;
  is_assigned_to : SET[1:?] OF part_property_select;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: other identifiers that may be used to distinguish the Material_identification. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

id: the identifier for the Material_identification.

is_assigned_to: the objects that this material information is provided for.

NOTE    Each object included in part_property_select is related to zero or one Material_identification object.

4.2.153 Material_property   

A Material_property is a type of Property that is the representation of a characteristic of a material.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Material_property
  SUBTYPE OF (Property);
  SELF\Property.definition : Material_property_definition;
  environment_condition : Data_environment;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

definition: the Material_property_definition that defines the Material_property.

environment_condition: the environmental condition in that the defined Material_property is applicable.

4.2.154 Material_property_assignment   

A Material_property_assignment is an association of a material, that is, a Material_identification object, with a material property, that is, a Material_property object. Many properties may be assigned to a single material by the instantiation of many Material_property_assignment objects.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Material_property_assignment;
  assigned_property : Material_property;
  definitional : OPTIONAL BOOLEAN;
  is_assigned_to : Material_identification;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

assigned_property: the associated Material_property that provides the representation of the value of the property.

definitional: a boolean value that specifies whether the assigned_property may be used to distinguish the is_assigned_to Material_identification from others of the same kind. A value of 'true' indicates that the assigned Material_property distinguishes the Material_identification from others. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

is_assigned_to: the Material_identification that a property value is assigned to.

4.2.155 Material_property_definition   

A Material_property_definition is a type of Property_definition that is a characteristic that depends on material aspects. A Material_property_definition is a type of Property_definition.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Material_property_definition
  SUBTYPE OF (Property_definition);
  name : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

name: the words by which the Material_property_definition is known.

EXAMPLE    'EM1' is an example for a 'name' that may be associated with a Material_property that is described as 'elastic modulus' in description.

4.2.156 Mating_definition   

A Mating_definition is a type of Assembly_definition. It is a view of a Part_version, defining the physical connection of two or more Part_instance objects. It includes technical information about the kind of connection. This information is independent from the hierarchical assembly structure.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Mating_definition
  SUBTYPE OF (Assembly_definition);
  mating_type : STRING;
INVERSE
  mated_parts : SET[2:?] OF Mated_part_association FOR relating;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

mating_type: the kind of mating, that is, how the items shall be mated together. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • 'bolted joint': Attachment of two or more items that are screwed together using screws, bolt nuts, and washers;
  • 'brazing': Attachment of two or more items established by soldering or brazing;
  • 'clasping': Attachment of two or more items established by using a clamp at one common outer border;
  • 'clinching': Attachment of two or more items established by pressing these items together and stamping texture at the point of contact;
  • 'clipping': Attachment of two or more items established by a clip (e.g. fixing the inner door panel at the inner door plate);
  • 'doweling': Attachment of two or more items using a pin that is fit into each of each part by pressing;
  • 'flanging': Attachment of two or more items by crimping a projected length of one part over the edge of the other part;
  • 'foam injection': Attachment of two or more items where foam is injected into a cavity to establish the connection;
  • 'gluing': Attachment of two items established by adhesion material;
  • 'laser-welding': Attachment of two or more items that are welded together using a laser technique;
  • 'press fit': Attachment of two or more items obtained by forces resulting from the selected size tolerances;
  • 'riveting': Attachment of two or more items that are riveted together at a certain spot using a rivet;
  • 'sewing': Attachment of two or more items that are sewn together.;

    EXAMPLE    Upholstering cloth is sewn together to form a seat pillow.

  • 'spot welding': Attachment of two or more items that are welded together at a certain welding spot;
  • 'stapling': Attachment of two or more items at a certain spot using a nail or a wire stitch to establish the connection;
  • 'welding': Attachment of two or more items by welding together with one weld bead.

mated_parts: the set of two or more Mated_part_association that reference a Mating_definition instance as values of their attributes with name relating.

4.2.157 Model_property   

A Model_property is a mechanism to assign a General_property_definition to an External_model, a Geometric_model, or a Styled_model.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Model_property;
  definition : General_property_definition;
  specified_value : model_property_value_select;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

definition: the General_property_definition that is assigned to an External_model, a Geometric_model, or a Styled_model.

specified_value: the model to which a General_property_definition is assigned.

4.2.158 Model_property_assignment   

A Model_property_assignment is an assignment of a Model_property to objects.

EXAMPLE    In the case of a welding operation, the welding points as a part of a wireframe model can be associated with a process operation to describe the locations where the robot has to weld for a welding process operation.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Model_property_assignment;
  assigned_property : Model_property;
  is_assigned_to : SET[1:?] OF model_property_select;
  validity_context : OPTIONAL validity_context_select;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

assigned_property: the Model_property that is associated to an application object.

is_assigned_to: the application objects for which a Model_property is provided.

validity_context: specifies the context in which a Model_property_assignment is applicable. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.159 Moments_of_inertia   

A Moments_of_inertia is a type of Shape_dependent_property that describes the matrix of inertia of a rigid body.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Moments_of_inertia
  SUBTYPE OF (Shape_dependent_property);
  SELF\Shape_dependent_property.is_defined_in : Cartesian_coordinate_space;
  inertia_value : ARRAY[1:3] OF ARRAY[1:3] OF Numerical_value;
  reference_axis_placement : Axis_placement;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

is_defined_in: the Cartesian_coordinate_space in which the property is applicable.

NOTE 1   The values of geometry related properties are specified relative to a Cartesian_coordinate_space.

EXAMPLE    The reference_axis_placement for the Moments_of_inertia is defined within the coordinate space. A Moments_of_inertia object may be specified in different coordinate spaces for different purposes.

inertia_value: the 9 inertia coefficients.

NOTE 1   The matrix defined by the inertia_value is symmetric with respect to the main diagonal. For that reason, the values of the coefficients are equal, if mirrored along this diagonal. As a consequence, there are 6 different values in the inertia_value.

reference_axis_placement: the Axis_placement which was used to calculate the inertia_value.

4.2.160 Named_size   

A Named_size is a type of Rectangular_size that is the definition of the size of a File or of a Document_definition where the size is specified by a standardized identifier.

EXPRESS specification:

END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

referenced_standard: a standard according to which the size is specified. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

size: the size of the object. If the size differs from the dimensions specified by the inherited 'width' and 'height' attributes the size is overridden.

4.2.161 Next_higher_assembly   

A Next_higher_assembly is a type of Assembly_component_relationship that is a relationship where the attribute related specifies a constituent of an assembly and the attribute relating specifies the immediate parent assembly of the constituent.

NOTE    A constituent may be a single part or an assembly.

EXAMPLE    The assembly carburettor may be assembled from single parts. The power train assembly is assembled from other assemblies.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Next_higher_assembly
  SUBTYPE OF (Assembly_component_relationship);
END_ENTITY;
(*

4.2.162 Numerical_value   

A Numerical_value is a type of Value_with_unit representing a quantity expressed with a numerical value and a unit.
