END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

value_component: the quantity of the Numerical_value.

4.2.163 Organization   

An Organization is a group of people involved in a particular business process.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Organization;
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  delivery_address : OPTIONAL Address;
  id : Id_with_context;
  name : STRING;
  organization_type : OPTIONAL STRING;
  postal_address : OPTIONAL Address;
  visitor_address : OPTIONAL Address;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: the additional identifiers used to distinguishes the Organization. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

delivery_address: specifies the address where goods are delivered. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

id: the identifier for the Organization.

NOTE    The assignment of the id is usually controlled by a registration authority. The registration authority may be a public organization that assigns identifiers to corporations, or it may be the parent corporation that assigns component identifiers to its components.

EXAMPLE    The id may be the code assigned to the Organization for a stock market listing, or it may be a department number.

name: the words by which the Organization is known.

organization_type: the type of the Organization. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • 'company': The organization_type specifies that the Organization is a company;
  • 'department': The organization_type specifies that the Organization is a department;
  • 'plant': The organization_type specifies that the Organization is a plant.

The value of this attribute need not be specified.

postal_address: specifies the address where letter mail is delivered. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

visitor_address: specifies the address where the organization receives visitors. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.164 Organization_in_contract   

An Organization_in_contract is a mechanism to associate the person who is signing a contract and the organization which the person is signing for, with a Contract.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Organization_in_contract;
  contracted_organization : Organization;
  organization_role : STRING;
  signed_by : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Date_and_person_organization;
  signed_contracts : SET[1:?] OF Contract;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

contracted_organization: specifies the organization that participates in the contract.

organization_role: specifies the function performed by the signing Organization with respect to the contract. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • 'contractor': The referenced Organization assigns the tasks that are subject of the Contract.;
  • 'contractee': The tasks that are subject of the Contract are assigned to the referenced Organization.

signed_by: specifies the set of Date_and_person_organization objects representing the personnel that signed the contract on behalf of the contracted organization and the date of the signature. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

signed_contracts: specifies the set of Contract objects the Organization_in_contract participates in.

4.2.165 Organization_or_person_in_organization_assignment   

An Organization_or_person_in_organization_assignment is an object that associates an Organization or a Person_in_organization with product data. This assignment provides additional information for the associated object. The provision of such data through this assignment has an organizational character whereas some objects require the same kind of data in order to be semantically complete. This assignment shall not be used to associate the corresponding organizational data with an object whose attributes are referencing the organizational data directly. The Organization_or_person_in_organization_assignment shall not be used for the purpose of specifying a relationship between two Person_in_organization objects, e.g., a succession in organizational responsibility. For these purposes, Person_in_organization_relationship shall be used.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Organization_or_person_in_organization_assignment;
  assigned_person_or_organization : person_organization_select;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  is_assigned_to : SET[1:?] OF date_time_person_organization_element_select;
  role : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

assigned_person_or_organization: specifies the concerned Organization or the Person_in_organization.

description: the text that provides further information about the Organization_or_person_in_organization_assignment. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

is_assigned_to: specifies the object with which the Organization_or_person_in_organization_assignment is associated.

role: specifies the responsibility of the assigned Person or Organization with respect to the object that it is applied to. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • 'author': The referenced object has been created by the assigned Person or Organization. The author holds the copyright;
  • 'classification officer': The assigned Person or Organization is formally responsible for the classification of the referenced object;
  • 'creator': The referenced object has been created by the assigned Person or Organization;
  • 'custodian': The assigned Person or Organization is responsible for the existence and integrity of the referenced object;
  • 'customer': The assigned Person or Organization acts as a purchaser or consumer of the referenced object;
  • 'design supplier': The assigned Person or Organization is the one who delivers the data describing the referenced object;

    EXAMPLE    The 'design supplier' may be a design by means of a three-dimensional model or a drawing.

  • 'editor': One or more attributes have been modified by the assigned Person or Organization;
  • 'id owner': The assigned Person or Organization is the one responsible for the designation of an identifier;
  • 'location': The assigned Organization is the place where the referenced object can be found or where it takes place;
  • 'manufacturer': The assigned Person or Organization is the one who produces the actual (physical) object;
  • 'owner': The assigned Person or Organization owns the referenced object, and has final say over its disposition and any changes to it;
  • 'read access’: The assigned Person or Organization neither has the right to modify any attributes of the referenced object, nor to modify, create or delete objects that are attached directly or indirectly to the referenced object;
  • 'supplier': The assigned Person or Organization is the one who delivers the actual (physical) object (e.g., a dealer);
  • 'wholesaler': The assigned Person or Organization is the one who is in the sales chain between the manufacturer and the supplier;
  • 'write access': The assigned Person or Organization has the right to modify the attributes of the referenced object, as well as to modify, create, or delete objects that are attached directly or indirectly to the referenced object.

4.2.166 Organization_relationship   

An Organization_relationship is a relationship between two Organization objects.

EXAMPLE 1   A team belongs to a department which itself belongs to a company. This organizational structure may be built up using the Organization_relationship mechanism.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Organization_relationship;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  related : Organization;
  relating : Organization;
  relation_type : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

description: the text that provides further information about the Organization_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

related: the second Organization in an Organization_relationship.

NOTE 1   The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

relating: the first of the two Organization objects in an Organization_relationship.

NOTE 2   The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

relation_type: the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • 'hierarchy': The related Organization is a sub organization of the relating Organization;
  • 'legal succession': The related Organization is the legal successor of the relating Organization;

    NOTE 3   An additional Date_or_date_time_assignmentmay be applied to the Organization_relationship in order to specify the time when the succession takes place.

  • 'reorganization': The related Organization is the successor of the relating Organization due to an organizational transfer of responsibility.

    EXAMPLE 2   The name of a department changes due to reorganization.

4.2.167 Part   

A Part is a identification of definition of a part. It collects the definitional information of the versions of a part. A Part shall always be categorized as 'piece part', 'product', 'software', 'tool', or 'raw material' using a Part_category.

NOTE 1   A Part does not represent an actual physical object of the real world.

NOTE 2   A Part may be either a single piece part, an assembly of arbitrary complexity, a raw material, or a tool.

EXAMPLE 1   In the context of cars, a Part may be the car as a whole, the assembly of the engine, the car body, a fender, the side window glass, grease, or a stamping die.

EXAMPLE 2   In the context of aeroplanes, a Part may be the air plane as a whole, the assembly of the engine, the body of the air plane, a fender, the side window glass, grease, or a stamping die.

NOTE 3   A Part is identified by an organization. The definition of the domain of uniqueness and the mechanism for guaranteeing the uniqueness of Part id are outside the scope of this capability.

NOTE 4   A Part may have zero or more versions. Versions of a Part are represented by the entity Part_version.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Part;
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  categories : SET[1:?] OF Part_category;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  id : Id_with_context;
  name : STRING;
  versions : SET[1:?] OF Part_version;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: the additional identifiers used to distinguishes the Part. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

NOTE 5   A particular codification for the values of this attribute may be specified in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

categories: specifies the Part_category objects of the Part.

NOTE 6   A Part shall always be categorized as 'piece part', 'product', 'software', 'tool', or 'raw material'.

description: the text that provides further information about the Part. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

id: the identifier for the Part.

name: the words by which the Part is known.

versions: specifies the Part_version objects of the Part.

4.2.168 Part_category   

A Part_category is a category of a Part with respect to specific criteria. The specific criteria are covered in the id attribute.

NOTE 1   The Part_category is used to distinguish a part in the Bill of Material (BOM).

NOTE 2   For the attribute id a set of predefined values is specified hereafter. If values other than the proposed ones are used, they should be of general categorizing nature. This kind of categorization ought not to be used to classify names or identifiers of objects, e.g., in order to classify part families; for this purposes ought to be used.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Part_category;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  name : STRING;
  scope : Organization;
INVERSE
  categorized_parts : SET[1:?] OF Part FOR categories;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

description: the text that provides further information about the Part_category. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

name: provides category information for the Part. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

EXAMPLE    Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • ‘piece part': The Part plays the role of a single piece part;
  • 'product': The Part plays the role of a product offered to the market;
  • 'raw material': The Part plays the role of raw material;
  • 'software': The Part plays the role of software;
  • 'tool': The Part plays the role of a tool.

scope: the organization which provided the categorization of the Part.

categorized_parts: the set of Part objects that are categorized by this Part_category.

4.2.169 Part_instance   

A Part_instance is the occurrence of an object in a product structure that is defined either by a Part_version, Part_version_view or as a Product_configuration.

EXAMPLE    In the case of a car, the Item 'wheel' is defined once. Its Part_version carries all the information necessary to define the wheel (e.g., its shape) independent of its usage. Additionally, there are 5 Part_instance objects for this wheel since there are 5 equal wheels used in a car: Front-left, front-right, rear-left, rear-right, and spare wheel. Each of these instances may carry additional information such as placement or function. Each Part_instance is a Single_part_instance, a Quantified_part_instance, a Selected_part_instance, or a Specified_part_instance.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Part_instance
  ABSTRACT SUPERTYPE OF (ONEOF (Quantified_part_instance,
                                Selected_part_instance,
                                Single_part_instance,
                                Specified_part_instance));
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  definition : part_instance_definition_select;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  id : Id_with_context;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: the additional identifiers used to distinguishes the Part_instance. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

definition: the Part_version, Part_version_view or the Product_configuration that serves as a definition for this particular occurrence. If an appropriate Part_version or Part_version_view is available, this object shall be used as definition, otherwise a Product_configuration shall be referenced.

description: the text that provides further information about the Part_instance. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

id: the identifier for the Part_instance.

4.2.170 Part_instance_relationship   

A Part_instance_relationship is a relationship between two Part_instance objects. Pre-defined semantics are provided by the two subtypes Replaced_usage_relationship and Same_time_machining_relationship.

NOTE    Arbitrary semantics of this entity can be defined by using the subtype General_part_instance_relationship.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Part_instance_relationship
  SUPERTYPE OF (ONEOF (General_part_instance_relationship,
                       Replaced_usage_relationship,
                       Same_time_machining_relationship));
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  related : Part_instance;
  relating : Part_instance;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

description: the text that provides further information about the Part_instance_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

related: the second of the two Part_instance objects related by the Part_instance_relationship.

relating: the first of the two Part_instance objects related by the Part_instance_relationship.

4.2.171 Part_property_assignment   

A Part_property_assignment is a type of Property_assignment that associates a property value with an object.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Part_property_assignment
  SUBTYPE OF (Property_assignment);
  definitional : OPTIONAL BOOLEAN;
  is_assigned_to : SET[1:?] OF part_property_select;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

definitional: specifies whether the associated Property object may be used to distinguish the assigned elements from others of the same kind. A value of 'true' indicates that the associated Property distinguishes it from others. The definitional is only meaningful, if the assigned elements are of type Part_version_view. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

is_assigned_to: the object that is characterized by the Property_value.

4.2.172 Part_shape   

A Part_shape is the definition of the shape of a Part_instance, Part_version, Part_version_view, Physical_breakdown_element or Physical_instance.

NOTE 1   A Part_shape is used to define the shape of a described object when the shape of the object varies according to the usage context of this object, e.g. shape of a flexible pipe when placed in a car.

NOTE 2   A Part_shape will also be used to identify the shape of a described object, regardless whether the object is flexible, fluid or solid, when a particular constraint, e.g. a location dimension, applies to an element of the shape of the object, in the context of a particular usage of this object.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Part_shape;
  described_object : part_information_select;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  elements : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Shape_element;
  id : OPTIONAL Id_with_context;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

described_object: the object the shape of which is defined by the Part_shape.

description: the text that provides further information about the Part_shape. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

elements: the constituents of the shape that a Part_shape assigns to its described_object. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

id: the identifier for the Part_shape. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.173 Part_version   

A Part_version is an identification of a version of a part. It serves as the collector of the data characterizing a realizable object in various application contexts.

NOTE 1   A Part_version is a part that may be produced, consumed, used to produce other Part_version objects, or offered to the market.

NOTE 2   The collection of defining information may be incomplete, i.e., not all of the Part_version_view objects needed to define a Part_version are associated with the Part_version.

NOTE 3   The set of all Part_version objects of a Part represents the history of the Part within a particular life cycle stage or over its complete life cycle.

NOTE 4   A Part_version does not have to be referenced by any Part_version_view.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Part_version;
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  id : Id_with_context;
INVERSE
  corresponding_product_identification : SET[0:1] OF Product_design_association FOR associated_part_version;
  part : Part FOR versions;
  views : SET[0:?] OF Part_version_view FOR part_version;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: the additional identifiers used to distinguishes the Part_version. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

description: the text that provides further information about the Part_version. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

id: the identifier for the Part_version.

corresponding_product_identification: the Product_design_association that associates this Part_version with a Product_configuration.

part: the Part with which the Part_version is associated.

views: the set of Part_version_view objects that are defined for the Part_version.

4.2.174 Part_version_relationship   

A Part_version_relationship is a relationship between two instances of Part_version. Unless specified in a specialization of this object, this relationship does not involve inheritance of data between the two related objects.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Part_version_relationship;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  related : Part_version;
  relating : Part_version;
  relation_type : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

description: the text that provides further information about the Part_version_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

related: specifies the second of the two Part_version objects related by the Part_version_relationship.

NOTE 1   The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

relating: specifies the first of the two Part_version objects related by the Part_version_relationship.

NOTE 2   The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

relation_type: specifies the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • 'derivation': The application object defines a deriving relationship where the related Part_version is based on the relating Part_version which is an earlier version of the same or of a different Part;
  • 'hierarchy': The application object defines a hierarchical relationship where the related Part_version is a subordinate version of the relating Part_version;

    EXAMPLE    'Rev. 1.1' and 'rev. 1.2' are subordinates of 'version 1'.

  • 'sequence': The application object defines a version sequence where the relating Part_version is the preceding version of the related Part_version that is the following version. For a given Part_version there shall be at most one Part_version_relationship of this relation_type referring to this Part_version as ' relating' and at most one Part_version_relationship of this relation_type referring as related.

4.2.175 Part_version_view   

A Part_version_view is a view of a Part_version that defines a characterization view of a version of a part. This view is relevant for the requirements of one or more life cycle stages and application domains and collects product data of the Part_version.

NOTE    The selection of data describing a Part_version may be different for assembly purposes, shipping purposes or analysis purposes.

Each Part_version_view is a General_part_version_view, a Collection_definition, or an Assembly_definition.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Part_version_view
  ABSTRACT SUPERTYPE OF (ONEOF (General_part_version_view,
                                Assembly_definition,
                                Collection_definition));
  additional_contexts : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Application_context;
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  id : Id_with_context;
  initial_context : Application_context;
  name : OPTIONAL STRING;
  part_version : Part_version;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_contexts: the set of Application_context objects in which this view of the Part_version is also relevant. The additional_contexts shall not contain the Application_context that is referenced as the initial_context. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

additional_ids: the additional identifiers used to distinguishes the Part_version_view. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

description: the text that provides further information about the Part_version_view. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

id: the identifier for the Part_version_view.

initial_context: the Application_context in which this view of the Part_version has been designed primarily.

name: the words by which the Part_version_view is known. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

part_version: the Part_version for which the Part_version_view is a view.

4.2.176 Part_version_view_instance_relationship   

A Part_version_view_instance_relationship is an association between a Part_version_view and a Part_instance.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Part_version_view_instance_relationship
  ABSTRACT SUPERTYPE OF (ONEOF (Assembly_component_relationship,
                                Collected_part_relationship,
                                General_part_version_view_instance_relationship));
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  related : Part_instance;
  relating : Part_version_view;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

description: the text that provides further information about the Part_version_view_instance_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

related: the Part_instance that is part of the Part_version_view_instance_relationship.

NOTE 1   The semantics of this attribute are defined by the specializations of Part_version_view_instance_relationship.

relating: the Part_version_view that is part of the Part_version_view_instance_relationship.

NOTE 2   The semantics of this attribute are defined by the specializations of Part_version_view_instance_relationship.

4.2.177 Part_version_view_relationship   

A Part_version_view_relationship is a relationship between two Part_version_view objects. Except if specified in a specialization of this object, this relationship does not involve inheritance of data between the two related objects.

Each Part_version_view_relationship is a Tool_part_relationship, a Replaced_version_view_relationship, a Geometrical_relationship, a Make_from_relationship, or a General_part_version_view_relationship.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Part_version_view_relationship
  ABSTRACT SUPERTYPE OF (ONEOF (General_part_version_view_relationship,
                                Geometrical_relationship,
                                Make_from_relationship,
                                Replaced_version_view_relationship,
                                Process_state_relationship,
                                Tool_part_relationship));
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  related : Part_version_view;
  relating : Part_version_view;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

description: the text that provides further information about the Part_version_view_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

related: the second of the Part_version_view objects that are part of the relationship.

NOTE 1   The semantics of this attribute are defined by the specializations of Part_version_view_relationship.

relating: the first of the Part_version_view objects that are part of the relationship.

NOTE 2   The semantics of this attribute are defined by the specializations of Part_version_view_relationship.

4.2.178 Path_segment   

A Path_segment is a portion of a complete kinematic path and describes either a point-to-point, a linear or a circular type of motion.

NOTE 1   Linear and circular types of paths are continuous motions, point-to-point paths are discontinuous motions.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Path_segment
  ABSTRACT SUPERTYPE OF (ONEOF (Circular_path,
                                Point_to_point_path,
                                Linear_path));
  placement_end : Axis2_placement_3d;
  t_end : REAL;
  transition : transition_code_enum;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

placement_end: the Axis2_placement_3d to which the parameters of the Path_segment refer. It is the location and orientation of the end-point of the Path_segment.

NOTE 2   The placement_end is specified to enable evaluation by manufacturing systems, which use the information to determine various machining parameters.

t_end: the parameter value that represents the end location of a travel along the Path_segment.

transition: the type of smoothness of the motion along the path. The following values shall be used:

  • 'cont same gradient': the motion occurs continuously with a constant gradient;
  • 'cont same gradient same curvature': gradient and curvature of the motion are constant;
  • 'continuous': the motion is continuous;
  • 'discontinuous': the motion is interrupted.

4.2.179 Person   

A Person is an individual human being who has some relationship to product data. The Person shall always be identified in the context of one or more organizations.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Person;
  first_name : OPTIONAL STRING;
  last_name : STRING;
  middle_names : OPTIONAL LIST[1:?] OF STRING;
  preferred_business_address : OPTIONAL Address;
  prefix_titles : OPTIONAL LIST[1:?] OF STRING;
  suffix_titles : OPTIONAL LIST[1:?] OF STRING;
INVERSE
  associated_organizations : SET[1:?] OF Person_in_organization FOR associated_person;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

first_name: the first element of the Person object's list of forenames. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

last_name: the person's name.

middle_names: the person's other forenames. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

preferred_business_address: specifies the location of the office of the Person. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

prefix_titles: the text that specifies the Person object's social or professional standing and appear before his or her names. The value of this attribute need not be specified. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

EXAMPLE 1   "Mr.", "Ms", "Dr." and combinations are examples of prefix_titles.

suffix_titles: the text that specifies the Person's social or professional standing and appear after his or her names. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

EXAMPLE 2   "Ph.D." and "Esquire" are examples of suffix_titles.

associated_organizations: specifies the Organizations to which the Person belongs to.

4.2.180 Person_in_organization   

A Person_in_organization is the specification of a Person in the context of an Organization.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Person_in_organization;
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  associated_organization : Organization;
  associated_person : Person;
  id : OPTIONAL Id_with_context;
  location : OPTIONAL Address;
  role : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: the additional identifiers used to distinguishes the Person_in_organization. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

associated_organization: specifies the Organization with which the Person is associated.

associated_person: specifies the Person.

id: the identifier for the Person_in_organization. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

NOTE    The id may be a staff number or a user id in a computer system.

location: specifies the relevant address of the Person_in_organization. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

role: specifies the relationship between the Person and the Organization.

4.2.181 Person_in_organization_relationship   

A Person_in_organization_relationship is a mechanism that specifies a relationship between two persons in an organization.

EXAMPLE    The owner of important product data leaves a company and therefore has a successor. This relationship may be built up using the Person_in_organization_relationship mechanism.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Person_in_organization_relationship;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  related : Person_in_organization;
  relating : Person_in_organization;
  relation_type : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

description: the text that provides further information about the Person_in_organization_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

related: specifies the second of the two objects related by the Person_in_organization_relationship.

relating: specifies the first of the two objects related by the Person_in_organization_relationship.

relation_type: specifies the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • 'successor': The related Person_in_organization is the successor of the relating Person_in_organization;

4.2.182 Physical_assembly_relationship   

A Physical_assembly_relationship is a mechanism to relate one Physical_instance as a component to another Physical_instance that plays the role of an assembly.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Physical_assembly_relationship;
  assembly : Physical_instance;
  component : Physical_instance;
  is_realization_of : Part_instance;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

assembly: the Physical_instance that serves as the assembly in the physical structure.

component: the Physical_instance that serves as a component in the physical structure.

is_realization_of: the Part_instance the physical component is the realization of.

4.2.183 Physical_breakdown   

A Physical_breakdown is a type of Breakdown that identifies a partitioning of a product into a set of Physical_breakdown_element objects. A Physical_breakdown is a view of the physical structure of a product by means of parent-child relationships. Not all elements of the physical product structure need to be included in a Physical_breakdown.

NOTE    Parent-child relationships are represented by Physical_breakdown_element_decomposition_relationship objects.

EXAMPLE    A physical breakdown may provide a decomposition of an automobile in terms of body, roof, bonnet, bumpers. This breakdown may be different from, and even orthogonal to, a parts decomposition.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Physical_breakdown
  SUBTYPE OF (Breakdown);
END_ENTITY;
(*

Informal propositions:

IP1: All elements of a Physical_breakdown shall be of type Physical_breakdown_element.

4.2.184 Physical_breakdown_element   

A Physical_breakdown_element is a type of Breakdown_element that identifies an element that is included in one or more Physical_breakdown objects.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Physical_breakdown_element
  SUBTYPE OF (Breakdown_element);
END_ENTITY;
(*

4.2.185 Physical_breakdown_element_decomposition_relationship   

A Physical_breakdown_element_decomposition_relationship is a relationship between a parent Physical_breakdown_element and a child Physical_breakdown_element.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Physical_breakdown_element_decomposition_relationship;
  related : Physical_breakdown_element;
  relating : Physical_breakdown_element;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

related: the child Physical_breakdown_element object of the relationship.

relating: the parent Physical_breakdown_element object of the relationship.

4.2.186 Physical_breakdown_element_relationship   

A Physical_breakdown_element_relationship is a relationship between two Physical_breakdown_element objects the meaning of which is defined by the attribute relation_type.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Physical_breakdown_element_relationship;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  related : Physical_breakdown_element;
  relating : Physical_breakdown_element;
  relation_type : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

description: the text that provides further information about the Physical_breakdown_element_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

related: the second of the two Physical_breakdown_element objects related by the Physical_breakdown_element_relationship.

NOTE 1   The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

relating: the first of the two Physical_breakdown_element objects related by the Physical_breakdown_element_relationship.

NOTE 2   The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

relation_type: the meaning of the relationship.

Where applicable, the following values shall be used:

  • 'decomposition': The related Physical_breakdown_element is one of potentially more components of the relating Physical_breakdown_element.

    NOTE 3   This case is identical to the functionality of Physical_breakdown_element_decomposition_relationship that should be used preferably.

  • 'specialization': The related Physical_breakdown_element fulfils the requirements of the relating Physical_breakdown_element in a more specific way than defined for the relating Physical_breakdown_element.

4.2.187 Physical_document_definition   

A Physical_document_definition is a type of Document_definition describing a piece of product data that is archived in a non-digital form.

EXAMPLE    Paper plots of technical drawings, micro fiche, or paper documents such as calculations or test reports are examples for a Physical_document_definition.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Physical_document_definition
  SUBTYPE OF (Document_definition);
  components : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Hardcopy;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

components: the physical realization of the Physical_document_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.188 Physical_instance   

A Physical_instance is an identification of a physically realized object.

NOTE 1   A Physical_instance may be identified by a serial number. A lot id may be provided additionally to the serial number.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Physical_instance;
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  id : Id_with_context;
  inventory_number : OPTIONAL STRING;
  is_realization_of : OPTIONAL physical_instance_definition_select;
  lot_id : OPTIONAL STRING;
  serial_number : OPTIONAL STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: the identification of a physically realized object. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

NOTE 2   A Physical_instance may be identified by a serial number. A lot id may be provided additionally to the serial number.

description: the text that provides further information about the Physical_instance. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

id: the identifier for the Physical_instance.

inventory_number: specifies an alphanumerical string to identify a Physical_instance in the detailed list of articles, such as goods and chattels, found in the possession of a person or enterprise. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

is_realization_of: specifies the Product_configuration, the Part_version, the Part_version_view or the Part_instance that collects the information defining the Physical_instance. If the Physical_instance plays the role of the root assembly in a physical assembly structure this attribute shall not be omitted. In other cases the information is redundant and shall be consistent with the is_realization_of of Physical_assembly_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

lot_id: specifies the identifier of the lot the Physical_instance is part of. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

serial_number: specifies the serial number of the Physical_instance. The value of this attribute need not be specified. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.189 Physical_instance_test_result   

A Physical_instance_test_result is a mechanism to associate a Physical_instance with measurements made on this Physical_instance.

NOTE    This object provides means to relate the characteristics of a real object with a design intent.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Physical_instance_test_result;
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  id : Id_with_context;
  test_activity : OPTIONAL test_activity_select;
  test_results : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Property;
  tested_instance : Physical_instance;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: the additional identifiers used to distinguishes the Physical_instance_test_result. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

description: the text that provides further information about the Physical_instance_test_result. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

id: the identifier for the Physical_instance_test_result.

test_activity: the Activity or the Process_operation_occurrence that has lead to the test result. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

EXAMPLE    A measuring process on a prototype is an example for a test_activity.

test_results: the characteristics that were determined by the performed test. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

tested_instance: the Physical_instance that was the subject of the test activity.

4.2.190 Planned_characteristic   

A Planned_characteristic is a means to associate design intent information based on manufacturing capabilities and component characteristics with an allocated requirement. A Planned_characteristic is a set of properties planned to be valid for all occurrences of the designed product under the conditions defined in the allocated requirement.

EXPRESS specification:

*)

  defined_for : Requirement_assignment;

END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

defined_for: the Requirement_assignment and such the requirement for the Planned_characteristic.

name: the words by which the Planned_characteristic is known. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

planned_characteristic: the design intent information of the Planned_characteristic in terms of Property objects.

4.2.191 Plib_class_reference   

A Plib_class_reference is a reference to a class in a library compliant to ISO 13584 (Parts Library).

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Plib_class_reference;
  code : STRING;
  supplier_bsu : STRING;
  version : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

code: the class in the PLIB library. The format of this code is defined in ISO 13584-42.

supplier_bsu: (basic semantic unit): the class in a PLIB library, in which the class is defined. The format of this specification is defined in ISO 13584-26.

version: the identification of a particular version of a class in a PLIB library. The format of this version is defined in ISO 13584-42.

4.2.192 Plib_property_reference   

A Plib_property_reference is a reference to a property in a library compliant to ISO 13584.

*)

  version : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*
