4.2.241 Selected_part_instance   

A Selected_part_instance is a type of Part_instance that is the identification of the occurrence of an object that is either defined as a Part_version, Part_version_view or as a Product_configuration and whose quantity depends on certain constraints.

EXAMPLE 1   In a BOM where the exact amount of grease or glue can usually not be specified as a quantity, the specification of this grease or glue are examples for Selected_part_instance objects.

EXAMPLE 2   To minimize the concentricity error of a wheel, weights are attached to the rim; this set of weights is a Selected_part_instance. The quantity as well as the position of these weights depends on the concentricity behaviour of each particular wheel as manufactured and tested.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Selected_part_instance
  SUBTYPE OF (Part_instance);
  criterion : STRING;
  quantity : Value_with_unit;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

criterion: the constraint that has to be evaluated for the Selected_part_instance.

EXAMPLE 3   'as required for balance' and 'as required for lubrication' are examples for a criterion.

quantity: the quantity of the part, tool or raw material foreseen as Selected_part_instance. The quantity shall be of type Value_limit or Value_range.

NOTE    If the quantity is to be specified as a minimum and/or a maximum, then Value_limit or Value_range may be used.

EXAMPLE 4   The quantity of engine oil used in a car may be in the range of 3.7 to 3.9 litres. This is expressed using Value_range as the quantity.

4.2.242 Serial_configuration   

A Serial_configuration is a type of Manufacturing_configuration that applies onwards from a given serial number of the product that is considered within the object referred to as is_solution_for.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Serial_configuration
  SUBTYPE OF (Manufacturing_configuration);
  end_number : OPTIONAL STRING;
  start_number : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

end_number: the serial number of that instance of the product that is the last instance for which the Serial_configuration applies. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

NOTE    If the end_number is not specified, it is not foreseen that the Serial_configuration ceases to be valid; i.e., the Serial_configuration is expected to apply to all serial numbers greater than the serial start number for the product for whose characteristics the Serial_configuration identifies a solution.

start_number: the serial number of that instance of the product that is the first instance for which the Serial_configuration applies.

4.2.243 Serial_effectivity   

A Serial_effectivity is a type of Effectivity for which the domain of applicability is defined as a possibly open-ended interval of serial numbers.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Serial_effectivity
  SUBTYPE OF (Effectivity);
  end_number : OPTIONAL STRING;
  start_number : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

end_number: the last valid serial number. The value of this attribute need not be specified. If the value for this attribute is not specified, the interval of applicability has no upper bound or it is implicitly defined via an Effectivity_relationship with relation_type 'inheritance'.

start_number: the first valid serial number.

4.2.244 Shape_dependent_property   

A Shape_dependent_property is a characteristic of the shape, or of a portion of the shape of an object. This object is either a Part, an occurrence of an Part in the product structure or the physical realization of an Part.

NOTE 1   A Shape_dependent_property is independent of the representations of the shape.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Shape_dependent_property
  ABSTRACT SUPERTYPE OF (ONEOF (Centre_of_mass,
                                General_shape_dependent_property,
                                Moments_of_inertia));
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  is_assigned_to : shaped_element_select;
  is_defined_in : OPTIONAL Cartesian_coordinate_space;
  value_determination : OPTIONAL STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

description: the text that provides further information about the Shape_dependent_property. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

is_assigned_to: specifies the object that the Shape_dependent_property is associated to.

is_defined_in: specifies the Cartesian_coordinate_space in which the property is applicable.

NOTE 1   The values of geometry-related properties are specified relative to a Cartesian_coordinate_space.

EXAMPLE    A Centre_of_mass may be specified in different coordinate spaces for different dimensioning applications.

The value of this attribute need not be specified.

value_determination: specifies information on how the Shape_dependent_property shall be interpreted. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • 'calculated': The value has been calculated;
  • 'designed': The value represents a value intended by the design;
  • 'estimated': The value has been estimated;
  • 'measured': The value has been measured;
  • 'required': The value represents a requirement.

The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.245 Shape_description_association   

A Shape_description_association is a mechanism to associate the definition of a shape or of a portion of a shape with a geometric representation.

NOTE    Through Shape_description_association, it is possible to associate objects with geometry defined in an external document; the same is possible through Document_assignment. The difference between the two possibilities is that in the case of Shape_description_association, it is the shape of the object that is assigned whereas Document_assignment may be us

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Shape_description_association;
  defining_geometry : shape_definition_select;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  is_defining_shape_for : shape_information_select;
  role : OPTIONAL STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

defining_geometry: the Geometric_model or the External_geometric_model that contains the shape information for the is_defining_shape_for.

description: the text that provides further information about the Shape_description_association. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

is_defining_shape_for: the object the shape of which is defined by defining_geometry.

role: the string that designates the function performed by the defining_geometry. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • 'detailed representation': The geometry in the referenced shape model provides a detailed representation of the object;
  • 'idealized representation': The geometry in the referenced shape model provides a simplified representation of the object, e.g., for analysis purposes.

EXAMPLE    'simplified representation', 'idealized representation' are examples of role.

NOTE    For analysis purposes an 'idealized representation' that is not fully detailed in every respect may be sufficient and be preferable due to less overhead implied by its usage.

The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.246 Shape_element   

A Shape_element is a is a portion of shape that has to be identified explicitly to be associated with other information.

NOTE    A Shape_element may be a Coating_layer. Shape_element objects can be classified using Class.

EXAMPLE 1   In order to identify a portion of one face of a shaft that shall have a surface coating applied to it, Shape_element is used.

EXAMPLE 2   An example for classifying Shape_element objects is to identify all parts of an air plane that constitute the outer surface of the plane and are therefore relevant for aerodynamic analyses.

EXAMPLE 3   The threaded portion of the shape of a bolt may be represented as a Shape_element, so that other properties, such as surface finish, may be associated with it.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Shape_element
  SUPERTYPE OF (Coating_layer);
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  id : OPTIONAL Id_with_context;
  name : OPTIONAL STRING;
INVERSE
  containing_shape : Part_shape FOR elements;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: the additional identifiers used to distinguish the Shape_element. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

description: the text that provides further information about the Shape_element. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

id: the identifier for the Shape_element. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

name: the words by which the Shape_element is known. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

containing_shape: the Part_shape that the Shape_element is part of.

4.2.247 Shape_element_relationship   

A Shape_element_relationship is a relationship between two Shape_element objects.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Shape_element_relationship;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  related : Shape_element;
  relating : Shape_element;
  relation_type : OPTIONAL STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

description: the text that provides further information about the Shape_element_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

related: the second of the two Shape_element objects related by the Shape_element_relationship.

NOTE    The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

relating: the first of the two Shape_element objects related by the Shape_element_relationship.

NOTE    The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

relation_type: the meaning of the relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

EXAMPLE    'transition' may be used to define the transition between two adjacent Coating_layer objects.

4.2.248 Simple_property   

A Simple_property is a simplified mechanism to associate a property value with an object.

NOTE 1   A Simple_property corresponds in the more detailed independent property concept to a Property_assignment of type Part_property_assignment or Process_property_assignment

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Simple_property;
  is_assigned_to : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF simple_property_select;
  property_type : STRING;
  specified_value : Property_value;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

is_assigned_to: specifies the object that is characterized by the Property_value.

NOTE 2   The attribute is_assigned_to of Simple_property corresponds in the more detailed independent property concept to Part_property_assignment. is_assigned_to or to Process_property_assignment. is_assigned_to

The value of this attribute need not be specified.

property_type: the property type that the Simple_property characterizes.

NOTE 3   The attribute property_type of Simple_property corresponds in the more detailed independent property concept to the attribute property_type of General_property_definition which is a subtype of Property_definition and which is referenced by the attribute definition of Property. The Property_value itself is referenced by Property_assignment.assigned_property

EXAMPLE    ’noise absorption’, ’power consumption’ or 'colour' are examples for the property_type of a Simple_property.

specified_value: specifies the Property_value that qualifies the Simple_property by a Value_with_unit, a String_value, or a Value_list.

NOTE 4   The attribute specified_value of Simple_property corresponds in the more detailed independent property concept to the attribute specified_value of the Property that itself is referenced by Property_assignment.assigned_property.

4.2.249 Single_part_instance   

A Single_part_instance is one particular occurrence of an object that is defined either as a Part_version, Part_version_view or as a Product_configuration.

NOTE    A Single_part_instance may or may not be associated with placement information using an Instance_placement.

EXAMPLE    In a Technical_solution for the 'front left brake', a 'brake disk' is used and its position is specified by a geometric Transformation.

A Single_part_instance is a type of Part_instance.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Single_part_instance
  SUBTYPE OF (Part_instance);
END_ENTITY;
(*

4.2.250 Specification   

A Specification is a characteristic of a product. A Specification discriminates one product from other members of the same Product_class. A Specification refers to a Specification_category that completes the semantics of the Specification.

NOTE 1   A Specification may be a characteristic of the members of more than one Product_class using Class_specification_association objects.

NOTE 2   A Specification in combination with a Configuration may be used to define under which conditions a Part is used in combination with a Product_class.

EXAMPLE    'coupe', 'hatch back', or 'sedan' are examples for specifications belonging to the Specification_category of type 'car body'. 'radio 1 with CD player' and 'radio 2 without CD player' are examples for specifications belonging to the Specification_category of type 'radio equipment'. 'disk brake' and 'drum brake' are examples for specifications belonging to the Specification_category of type 'braking system'.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Specification;
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  category : Specification_category;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  id : Id_with_context;
  name : OPTIONAL STRING;
  package : BOOLEAN;
  version_id : OPTIONAL STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: the additional identifiers used to distinguish the Specification. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

category: the Specification_category that completes the semantics of the Specification.

description: the text that provides further information about the Specification. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

id: the identifier for the Specification.

NOTE 1   The scope of uniqueness is usually dependent on the form of implementation.

name: the words by which the Specification is known. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

package: specifies whether this Specification represents a package of Specification objects or not. Such a Specification combines those Specification objects that shall be offered to the market as a set. In the case where package is 'true', there shall be exactly one Specification_inclusion per Product_class considered, that refers to this Specification by its attribute if_condition. The Specification objects that are members of the package, shall be specified in the attribute included_specification of the Specification_inclusion.

NOTE 2   Commercial packages may be defined by the marketing department.

NOTE 3   Usually the members of a package belong to distinct Specification_category objects.

EXAMPLE    A sports package contains sports seats, a special steering wheel, special tyres and wheels. A winter package contains heated front seats, heated windshield washers, heated exterior mirrors, and special tyres.

version_id: the identification of a particular version of a Specification. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.251 Specification_category   

A Specification_category is a definition of a set of Specification objects serving the same purpose.

EXAMPLE 1   The category 'kind of drive' for the Specification objects 'front wheel drive' and 'rear wheel drive' or the category 'level of equipment' for the Specification objects 'standard', 'comfortable', and 'luxurious' are examples for Specification_category objects.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Specification_category;
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  description : STRING;
  id : Id_with_context;
  implicit_exclusive_condition : BOOLEAN;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: the additional identifiers used to distinguish the Specification_category. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

description: the text that provides further information about the Specification_category.

EXAMPLE 2   The description 'trim' characterizes a Specification_category for Specification objects that controls the quality and colour of the interior parts including, e.g., inner door panels and upholstery. Other examples are 'kind of drive', 'rear brake type', 'brake power regulator', 'radio equipment', or 'type of car body'.

id: the identifier for the Specification_category.

EXAMPLE 3   The scope of uniqueness may be set by the extent of a physical file or database.

NOTE 1   The scope of uniqueness is usually dependent on the form of implementation.

implicit_exclusive_condition: specifies whether the Specification objects within the Specification_category are mutually exclusive for the production of one particular product. A value of 'true' indicates that the referenced objects are mutually exclusive for the production of the particular product.

EXAMPLE 4   'safety equipment' is an example for a non mutually exclusive Specification_category if, e.g., ABS and air bag are Specification objects in this category. 'engine' is an example for a Specification_category with an implicit_exclusive_condition since usually only one engine can be mounted for power supply.

NOTE 2   More complex conditions can be handled using Specification_expression objects.

4.2.252 Specification_category_hierarchy   

A Specification_category_hierarchy is a used to build up hierarchical structures of Specification_category objects.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Specification_category_hierarchy;
  sub_category : Specification_category;
  super_category : Specification_category;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

sub_category: the lower level of Specification_category in Specification_category_hierarchy.

super_category: the higher level of Specification_category in Specification_category_hierarchy.

4.2.253 Specification_expression   

A Specification_expression is a combination of Specification objects formed by Boolean operations.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Specification_expression;
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  id : OPTIONAL Id_with_context;
  operands : SET[1:?] OF specification_operand_select;
  the_operation : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: the additional identifiers used to distinguish the Specification_expression. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

description: the text that provides further information about the Specification_expression. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

id: the identifier for the Specification_expression.

NOTE 3   The scope of uniqueness is usually dependent on the form of implementation.

The value of this attribute need not be specified.

operands: the operands of the Boolean operation that are either Specification objects or other Specification_expression objects. In case the_operation is 'not' there shall be exactly one operand.

the_operation: the kind of Boolean operation. The following kinds of operations are permitted:

  • 'and': all of the identified Specification objects shall be used;
  • 'or': a subset or all of the identified Specification objects shall be used;
  • 'oneof': exactly one of the identified Specification objects shall be used;
  • not': The identified Specification shall not be used. 'not' is an unary operation.

4.2.254 Specification_inclusion   

A Specification_inclusion is a representation of the statement that specifies that the application of a Specification or of a Specification_expression implies the inclusion of an additional Specification or Specification_expression.

EXAMPLE    The source of such a completion may be a customer order.

NOTE 1   The Specification_inclusion is intended to complete the set of Specification objects for a Class_specification_association in order to enable the manufacturing of the product on the basis of an initial set of Specification objects defined.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Specification_inclusion;
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  id : OPTIONAL Id_with_context;
  if_condition : specification_operand_select;
  included_specification : specification_operand_select;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: the additional identifiers used to distinguish the Specification_inclusion. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

description: the text that provides further information about the Specification_inclusion. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

id: the identifier for the Specification_inclusion.

NOTE 2   The scope of uniqueness is usually dependent on the form of implementation.

The value of this attribute need not be specified.

if_condition: the Specification or the Specification_expression that serves as the condition for the inclusion.

included_specification: the Specification or the Specification_expression objects that are to be included. The included_specification shall not reference a Specification_expression with an operation of type 'or' or 'oneof', except for negating expressions, i.e., as participants in an expression preceded by a 'not' operator. Expressions of operator 'not' shall not be nested within one another.

In the case where more than one Specification is to be included a Specification_expression of type 'and' shall be used.

NOTE 3   In the case where the included_specification is a 'not' expression, the object actually defines an exclusion.

4.2.255 Specified_part_instance   

A Specified_part_instance is a mechanism to identify a certain Part_instance in a multi-level assembly structure that reuses partial decompositions.

EXAMPLE    A 'chassis' consists among others of the sub assemblies 'front axle' and 'rear axle'. Both axle assemblies consist, among others, of the 'left wheel' and the 'right wheel'. In order to identify the 'left wheel' of the 'rear axle', the Specified_part_instance object references 'left wheel' as related instance, 'rear axle' as 'upper usage', and 'chassis' as assembly_context.

The definition of a Specified_part_instance shall be the same object as the one referenced by the 'related instance' as the definition.

A Specified_part_instance is a type of Part_instance.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Specified_part_instance
  SUBTYPE OF (Part_instance);
  assembly_context : Assembly_definition;
  sub_assembly_relationship : Part_instance;
  upper_assembly_relationship : Part_instance;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

assembly_context: an Assembly_definition object in which the instance identified by this mechanism is used.

sub_assembly_relationship: the Part_instance that is to be identified. The sub_assembly_relationship shall not be of type Specified_part_instance.

upper_assembly_relationship: the Part_instance in which the related instance is used. This Part_instance shall be the immediate upper level instance or another Specified_part_instance.

4.2.256 String_value   

A String_value is a type of Property_value that represents a sequence of one or more alphanumeric characters.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY String_value
  SUBTYPE OF (Property_value);
  value_component : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

value_component: specifies the string represented by the String_value.

4.2.257 Styled_model   

A Styled_model is a set of geometric or annotation elements that have presentation information.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Styled_model ABSTRACT
  ABSTRACT SUPERTYPE ;
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  id : Id_with_context;
  model_type : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: the additional identifiers used to distinguish the Styled_model. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

id: the identifier for the Styled_model.

model_type: specifies the type of the Styled_model.

Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • 'styled geometric model': The assignment specifies that the Styled_modelis a set of geometric elements that have presentation information;
  • 'styled annotation model': The assignment specifies that the Styled_modelis a set of annotation elements;

4.2.258 Supplied_object_relationship   

A Supplied_object_relationship is a relationship between two elements of the supplied_object_select list.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Supplied_object_relationship;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  related : supplied_object_select;
  relating : supplied_object_select;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

description: the text that provides further information about the Supplied_object_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

related: the second of the two supplied_object_select objects related by the Supplied_object_relationship.

relating: the first of the two supplied_object_select objects related by the Supplied_object_relationship.

4.2.259 Supplier_solution   

A Supplier_solution is a type of Alternative_solution that is an alternative solution that is provided by a particular supplier.

EXAMPLE    The Physical_breakdown_element 'tyre' has a Technical_solution of '225x50 VR17' with suppliers A, B, or C. A Supplier_solution is associated with each of these suppliers.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Supplier_solution
  SUBTYPE OF (Alternative_solution);
  probability_rate : OPTIONAL REAL;
  supplier : Organization;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

probability_rate: the share that is assigned to the supplier in the context of the inherited attribute base_element. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

supplier: the Organization that acts as supplier for the Supplier_solution.

4.2.260 Surface_condition   

A Surface_condition is a definition of a characteristic or property of a surface of a part.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Surface_condition ABSTRACT
  ABSTRACT SUPERTYPE ;
  condition_type : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

condition_type: specifies the type of the Surface_condition.

Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • 'visual appearance': specifies that the Surface_condition is the appearance of a surface of a part regarding the optical impression;
  • 'tactile appearance': specifies that the Surface_condition is the appearance of a surface of a part regarding the sense of touch;
  • 'treatment result': specifies that the Surface_condition is a result of a certain treatment;
  • 'surface texture': specifies that the Surface_condition is the characterization of irregularities of the surface of a shape or of a portion of a shape;
  • 'contact ratio': specifies that the Surface_condition is the measure of the quality of contact of a shape on a reference surface;
  • 'hardness': specifies that the Surface_condition is the hardness of a material on its surface;

4.2.261 Technical_solution   

A Technical_solution is a type of Alternative_solution that is an alternative solution where the functional requirements are fulfilled in a certain technical way.

EXAMPLE    'disc brake', 'disc brake ventilated', 'disc brake with ABS' for Physical_breakdown_element 'front left brake' are examples of Technical_solution objects.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Technical_solution
  SUBTYPE OF (Alternative_solution);
END_ENTITY;
(*

4.2.262 Template_instance   

A Template_instance is a replica of a Geometric_model, of a Styled_model, or of an External_model. The location of the replica and any additional geometrical transformation to be applied to the replica, i.e., uniform scaling, rotation or mirroring, are specified by the attributes 'origin' and ’target’.

NOTE 1   In the case where the units of the Cartesian coordinate space of the definition are different from the units to be applied to the Template_instance, unit conversion is required.

NOTE 2   In case of length unit conversion this conversion applies in addition to the scale attribute.

EXAMPLE    In a technical drawing of a mechanical part with several identical drilling holes, the hole geometry (circle) together with its annotation elements (diameter dimension and centrelines) is defined once. This particular definition is instantiated several times at different locations by corresponding Template_instance objects.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Template_instance;
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  definition : template_definition_select;
  id : Id_with_context;
  name : OPTIONAL STRING;
  origin : Axis_placement;
  scale : OPTIONAL REAL;
  target : explicit_transformation_select;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: the additional identifiers used to distinguishes the Template_instance. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

definition: the object to be replicated.

id: the identifier for the Template_instance.

name: the words by which the Template_instance is known. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

origin: the Axis_placement that defines the origin of the replicated object.

scale: the scaling factor for all Cartesian coordinate directions. The scaling factor shall be positive. If the scaling factor is omitted, it shall be 1.0. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

target: the geometrical transformation applied to the instance. All transformations that can be expressed by an orthonormal 2 × 2 (for 2D) or 3 × 3 (for 3D) matrix can be applied.

EXAMPLE    Examples for suitable operations are rotation and mirroring.

4.2.263 Text_specification   

A Text_specification is a representation that specifies a text.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Text_specification;
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  description : STRING;
  id : OPTIONAL Id_with_context;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: the others identifiers that distinguish the Text_specification. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

description: the text that provides further information about the Text_specification.

id: the identifier for the Text_specification. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.264 Time_interval   

A Time_interval is the specification of a unit of time.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Time_interval;
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  end_definition : period_or_date_select;
  id : OPTIONAL Id_with_context;
  name : OPTIONAL STRING;
  start_definition : event_or_date_select;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: the additional identifiers that distinguish the Time_interval. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

description: the text that provides further information about the Time_interval. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

end_definition: defines the end of the Time_interval, either by referring to a bound, or specifying the extend of the Time_interval by a Duration. If the end_definition refers to an Event or Date_time, this particular bound of the resulting interval is excluded from it.

id: the identifier for the Time_interval. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

name: the words by which the Time_interval is known. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

start_definition: defines the beginning of the Time_interval. The bound specified by the start_definition is included in the resulting interval.

4.2.265 Time_interval_assignment   

A Time_interval_assignment is an association of an Time_interval with some product data. The Time_interval_assignment shall neither be used to convey effectivity information, i.e., information concerning valid use of product data, nor to convey retention information, nor duration information.

NOTE    Such information is conveyed using Effectivity, Retention_period, and Duration respectively.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Time_interval_assignment;
  assigned_time_interval : Time_interval;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  is_assigned_to : SET[1:?] OF general_organizational_data_select;
  role : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

assigned_time_interval: specifies the Time_interval that is associated with the product data.

description: the text that provides further information about the Time_interval_assignment. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

is_assigned_to: specifies the set of objects of product data with which the Time_interval_assignment is assigned.

role: specifies the action associated with the Time_interval_assignment. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • 'installation': The assignment specifies that the object referenced as is_assigned_to was mounted in a product during the given interval of time;

4.2.266 Time_interval_configuration   

A Time_interval_configuration is a type of Manufacturing_configuration that applies for a given period.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Time_interval_configuration
  SUBTYPE OF (Manufacturing_configuration);
  configuration_period : Time_interval;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

configuration_period: the period for which the configuration of the configured_element is valid.

4.2.267 Time_interval_effectivity   

A Time_interval_effectivity is a type of Effectivity for which the domain of applicability is defined as a Time_interval.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Time_interval_effectivity
  SUBTYPE OF (Effectivity);
  effectivity_period : Time_interval;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

effectivity_period: the Time_interval that defines the domain of validity.

4.2.268 Tool_part_relationship   

A Tool_part_relationship is a type of Part_version_view_relationship that is a relationship between two Part_version_view objects. It establishes a relationship between a part (related) and a tool (relating) that is used to produce the part.

EXAMPLE    This relationship is, by default, valid only in the application contexts that are relevant for both related Part_version_view objects.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Tool_part_relationship
  SUBTYPE OF (Part_version_view_relationship);
  placement : OPTIONAL transformation_select;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

placement: specifies the relative position of the Item representing the part with respect to the local coordinate system of the Item representing the tool. In the case where the placement is realized by a Template_instance, the scale factor of that Template_instance shall be omitted or set to 1. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.269 Transformation   

A Transformation is a geometric transformation composed of translation and rotation. Scaling is not included.

Each Transformation is a Transformation_3d or a Transformation_2d.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Transformation
  ABSTRACT SUPERTYPE OF (ONEOF (Transformation_2d,
                                Transformation_3d));
  name : OPTIONAL STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

name: the words by which the Transformation is known. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.270 Transformation_2d   

A Transformation_2d is the definition of a geometric transformation in two-dimensional space. A Transformation_2d is a type of Transformation.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Transformation_2d
  SUPERTYPE OF (ONEOF (Explicit_transformation_2d,
                       Implicit_transformation_2d))
  SUBTYPE OF (Transformation);
END_ENTITY;
(*

4.2.271 Transformation_3d   

A Transformation_3d is the definition of a geometric transformation in three-dimensional space.

A Transformation_3d is a type of Transformation.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Transformation_3d
  SUPERTYPE OF (ONEOF (Explicit_transformation_3d,
                       Implicit_transformation_3d))
  SUBTYPE OF (Transformation);
END_ENTITY;
(*

4.2.272 Unit   

A Unit is a quantity chosen as a standard in terms of which other quantities may be expressed. The types of units supported by this standard are SI units as well as derived or conversion based units as defined in ISO 10303-41.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Unit;
  kind : OPTIONAL STRING;
  name : STRING;
  prefix : OPTIONAL prefix;
  quantity : OPTIONAL quantity;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

kind: specifies the system in which the Unit is defined. Where applicable the following value shall be used: 'SI system'.

EXAMPLE 1   'SI system'

The value of this attribute need not be specified.

name: the words by which the Unit is known.

EXAMPLE 2   'newton', 'pascal', 'metre', 'gram', 'gram','litre', or 'volt' are examples for the name.

prefix: the specification of the ratio with the unit specified by the name. Where applicable the following values shall be used: exa, peta, tera, giga, mega, kilo, hecto, deca, deci, centi, milli, micro, nano, pico, femto, atto.

EXAMPLE 3   'milli' specifies that the unit is 0.001 times the unit specifed by the name.

The value of this attribute need not be specified.

quantity: the type of property that the Unit shall be used for. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

EXAMPLE 4   The unit 'metre' is used to measure quantities of type 'length'.

4.2.273 Value_limit   

A Value_limit is a type of Value_with_unit with a qualified numerical value representing either the lower limit or the upper limit of a particular physical characteristic.

EXAMPLE    '30.5 max' and '5 min' are examples for a Value_limit.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Value_limit
  SUBTYPE OF (Value_with_unit);
  limit : NUMBER;
  qualifier : limit_qualifier;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

limit: specifies the value of the limit.

qualifier: specifies the kind of the limit. The following values shall be used:

  • 'maximum': The specified limit is an upper limit;
  • 'minimum': The specified limit is a lower limit.

4.2.274 Value_list   

A Value_list is a type of Property_value with an ordered collection of Property_value objects.

EXAMPLE    A General_property_definition may be composed of different property values such as 'mass', 'speed', and 'age' which are altogether necessary in a given context. The Value_list collects all of them in a given order, such that each is identifiable by its index in the list.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Value_list
  SUBTYPE OF (Property_value);
  values : LIST[1:?] OF Property_value;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

values: specifies the ordered collection of Property_value objects that together are provided as a Property_value.

4.2.275 Value_range   

A Value_range is a type of Value_with_unit with a pair of numerical values representing the range in which the value shall lie.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Value_range
  SUBTYPE OF (Value_with_unit);
  lower_limit : NUMBER;
  upper_limit : NUMBER;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

lower_limit: specifies the minimum acceptable value that is constrained by the Value_range.

upper_limit: specifies the maximum acceptable value that is constrained by the Value_range.

4.2.276 Value_with_unit   

A Value_with_unit is a type of Property_value with either a single numerical measure, or a range of numerical measures with upper, lower, or upper and lower bounds.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Value_with_unit
  ABSTRACT SUPERTYPE OF (ONEOF (Numerical_value,
                                Value_limit,
                                Value_range))
  SUBTYPE OF (Property_value);
  significant_digits : OPTIONAL INTEGER;
  unit : Unit;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

significant_digits: specifies the number of decimal digits that are relevant for the use of the Value_with_unit. If present, the numerical measure or range may be specified using more digits than the significant digits but shall not be specified using less digits. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

unit: specifies the unit in which the Value_with_unit is expressed.

4.2.277 Work_order   

A Work_order is the authorization for one or more Activity objects to be performed.

NOTE    One or more means that it is controlling the main activity and any sub-activity related to the activity by Activity_relationship with relation_type of 'decomposition'.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Work_order;
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  id : Id_with_context;
  in_response_to : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Work_request;
  is_controlling : SET[1:?] OF Activity;
  order_type : STRING;
  version_id : OPTIONAL STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: the additional identifiers that distinguish the Work_order. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

description: the text that provides further information about the Work_order. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

id: the identifier for the Work_order.

in_response_to: the set of zero, one or more instances of Work_request that define the expected results. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

is_controlling: the Activity objects that are controlled by this particular Work_order.

order_type: the order_type specifies the kind of the Work_order. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • 'design deviation permit': An authorization for a deviation from the approved design data;
  • 'design release': An authorization for the design of a product or of an item or to create a bill of material;
  • 'management resolution': An authorization by a committee, such as the board of directors, to design or change an item;
  • 'manufacturing release': An authorization for the manufacturing process of a product or of an item;
  • 'production deviation permit': An authorization for a deviation from the approved manufacturing process.

version_id: the identification of a particular version of a Work_order. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.278 Work_request   

A Work_request is a solicitation for some work to be done.

NOTE    These requests may not be acted upon depending on the authorization granted to the request or its associated Work_order.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Work_request;
  additional_ids : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Id_with_context;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  id : Id_with_context;
  notified_persons : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF Date_and_person_organization;
  request_type : STRING;
  requestor : Date_and_person_organization;
  scopes : OPTIONAL SET[1:?] OF activity_assignment_select;
  status : STRING;
  version_id : OPTIONAL STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

additional_ids: the additional identifiers that distinguish the Work_request. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

description: the text that provides further information about the Work_request. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

id: the identifier for the Work_request.

notified_persons: the personnel that shall be informed about the Work_request and the date when the personnel or organization shall be informed. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

request_type: the intention of the Work_request. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • 'change of standard': A request to translate a change to a standard into action;
  • 'cost reduction': A request aimed at reducing the engineering and manufacturing costs of an item;
  • 'customer rejection': A request resulting from a rejection by a customer;
  • 'customer request': A request for an activity that is necessary to solve the request of a customer;
  • 'durability improvement': A request aimed at extending the life time of an item;
  • 'government regulation': A request resulting from legal requirements;
  • 'procurement alignment': A request to adjust the purchasing process of different items;
  • 'production alignment': A request to adjust the manufacturing process of different items;
  • 'production relief': A request aimed at achieving a simpler assembly and production process;
  • 'production requirement': A request for an activity that is necessary from a production point of view;
  • 'quality improvement': A request aimed at increasing the quality of an item;
  • 'security reason': A request for an activity that is necessary from a security point of view;
  • 'standardization': A request to unify variants of an item;
  • 'supplier request': A request for an activity necessary to solve the request of a supplier;
  • 'technical improvement': A request aimed at improving the technical aspects of an item;
  • 'tool improvement': A request aimed at increasing the useful life of a tool.

requestor: the person or organization who issued the Work_request and the date when this person or organization issued the Work_request.

scopes: the objects that are subject to the Work_request. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

status: the text that provides a user interpretable designation for the level of completion of the study and resolution of the Work_request.

EXAMPLE    The designations 'drafted', 'issued', 'deferred', 'in-hand', 'completed', 'cancelled', and 'rejected' are examples of request status.

version_id: the identification of a particular version of a Work_request. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

4.2.279 Work_request_relationship   

A Work_request_relationship is a relationship between two Work_request objects.

EXPRESS specification:

*)
ENTITY Work_request_relationship;
  description : OPTIONAL STRING;
  related : Work_request;
  relating : Work_request;
  relation_type : STRING;
END_ENTITY;
(*

Attribute definitions:

description: the text that provides further information about the Work_request_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

related: the second of the two Work_request objects related by the Work_request_relationship.

NOTE 1   The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

relating: the first of the two Work_request objects related by the Work_request_relationship.The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

relation_type: the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

  • 'dependency': The related Work_request is dependent on the relating Work_request.

NOTE 2   This means that the related Work_request has the same Work_request direction as the relating Work_request;



*)
END_SCHEMA;  -- Ap242_business_object_model_arm
